recipes.title: Marinated Salmon Steaks
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 167

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen salmon (or halibut) steaks, cut 1 inch thick
finely shredded lemon, lime, or orange peel

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut steaks into serving-size portions. For marinade, in a shallow dish combine juice, oil, lemon peel, Worcestershire sauce, rosemary or thyme, and garlic.
Place fish in marinade. Pour marinade over fish. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes, turning fish once.

Place fish on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan. Brush with half of the remaining marinade. Broil 4 inches from the heat 5 minutes. Turn fish. Brush with remaining marinade. Broil for 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 167)

recipes.title: Halibut with Sherry Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen halibut (or other fish) steaks, cut 1 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Place fish on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan. Brush with half of the margarine, melted. Broil 4 inches from the heat 5 minutes. Turn fish. Brush with remaining margarine. Broil for 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

Meanwhile, in a small saucepan cook onions and garlic in the 4 tablespoons margarine or butter till tender. Stir in flour. Add sherry and broth all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Add cheese and beer. Cook and stir till cheese melts. Spoon over fish. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 168)

recipes.title: Dijon-Mustard Fillets
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. Place fish on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from the heat till fish flakes easily with a fork. (Allow 4 to 6 minutes per 1/2-inch thickness. Turn once if more than 1 inch thick.)
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan stir together sour cream, milk, mustard, chives, and a dash pepper. Cook till hot (do not boil). Serve over fish. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 168)

recipes.title: Teriyaki Shark
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen shark steaks, cut 1 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch cubes. Place fish, mushrooms, onions in a plastic bag; set bag into a bowl. Combine oil, wine or orange juice, garlic, orange peel, and marinate at room temperature for 2 hours, turning bag occasionally. Drain fish cubes.

On eight 12-inch skewers alternately thread fish cubes, mushrooms, and onions, leaving about 1/4 inch between pieces. Place on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Turn kabobs over. Broil for 4 to 6 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork. To serve, add a tomato to each skewer. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 168)

recipes.title: Orange Swordfish Kabobs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen swordfish steaks, cut 1 inch thick
ingredients.prep_note: tuna or shark makes great kabobs because of their firm, steak-like texture

ingredients.item: large green onions, cut into 2-inch lengths
finely shredded orange or cherry tomatoes

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch cubes. Place fish, mushrooms, and onions in a plastic bag; set bag in a bowl. Combine oil, wine or orange juice, garlic, orange peel. Seal bag and marinate at room temperature for 2 hours, turning bag occasionally. Drain fish cubes, mushrooms, and onions, reserving marinade.
On eight 12-inch skewers alternately thread fish cubes, mushrooms, and onions, leaving about 1/4 inch between pieces. Place on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan.
Broil 4 inches from the heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Turn kabobs over. Broil for 4 to 6 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork. To serve, add a tomato to each skewer. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 168)

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Fish Kabobs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 169

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen swordfish, tuna, or tuna steaks, cut 1 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch cubes. Cook carrots in a small amount of boiling water for 10 to 12 minutes or till almost tender; drain.
For the sauce, in a small saucepan combine preserves, lemon juice, and oil. Cook over low heat till preserves melt, stirring constantly.

Alternately thread fish cubes, carrot slices, and pineapple chunks on four 8-inch kabobs, leaving about 1/4 inch between pieces. Place kabobs on the greased unheated rack of broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Turn kabobs. Brush with sauce during the last 2 minutes of broiling. Brush again with sauce before serving.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 169)

recipes.title: Fish with Beer-Cheese Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 170

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets or steaks

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. In a large skillet cook fish in hot oil, uncovered, for 4 to 6 minutes per 1/2-inch thickness or till fish flakes easily with a fork (turning fish once if fish is 1 inch thick or more). Keep warm.

For sauce, in a saucepan cook onion in margarine till tender. Add flour and, if desired, mustard. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add cheese and beer. Cook and stir till cheese melts. Spoon over fish. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 170)

recipes.title: Citrus Baked Halibut
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 170

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen halibut steaks, chopped on thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Arrange in an 8x8x2-inch baking dish. Cook orange and garlic in margarine. Stir in parsley and lemon juice. Pour over fish.
Bake in a 400° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 170)

recipes.title: Baked Fish with Mushrooms
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 171

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets or steaks, cut 1/2 to 3/4 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Arrange fish in a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with mushrooms, onion, and tarragon. Dot with margarine. Sprinkle with salt and paprika.
Bake, covered, in a 450° oven for 6 to 10 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 171)

recipes.title: Broccoli-Stuffed Sole
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 171

ingredients.item: frozen cut broccoli (or other fish fillets)
cream cheese with chives and onion
white wine or dry white wine

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. For stuffing, cook broccoli according to package directions. Drain. Cut up any large pieces. Combine broccoli and cheeses.
Place stuffing at one end of each fillet. Roll up fish. Secure with wooden toothpicks, if necessary.
Place fish rolls with stuffing side up in a 1-quart casserole; sprinkle with crumbs. Set aside.
In a saucepan cook milk and wine over medium heat, stirring often. Serve over fish. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 171)

recipes.title: Fish en Papillote
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 172
recipes.description: En papillote (pah-pee-YOHT) is French for 'in paper.' It's a simple yet elegant way to cook fish.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen skinless pompano, perch, sole, or flounder fish fillets

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut 4 pieces of parchment paper or brown paper into heart shapes, 12 inches wide and 9 inches long.

In a large skillet bring water, lemon slices, bay leaf, and bouillon granules to boiling. Add fish. Simmer, covered, for 4 to 6 minutes or till fish flakes easily. Using a slotted spoon, carefully remove fish.
In a saucepan melt margarine; stir in flour and mustard. Add milk; cook and stir till thickened.

To assemble each packet, place one fillet on half of each parchment heart. Top with one-fourth of the sauce. Fold the other half of the heart over fillet. Starting at the top, seal by turning up edges of heart and folding in twice. At bottom, twist the tip of heart to seal. Place packets on a large baking sheet. Bake in a 400° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till slightly puffed. Transfer to dinner plates. To serve, cut an X in top of each. Pull back the paper. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 172)

recipes.title: Chilled Salmon Steaks
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 173

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen salmon steaks, cut 1/2 to 3/4 inches thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Place steaks in a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Add bouillon to boiling water. Pour over fish.

Bake in a 450° oven 8 to 12 minutes or till fish flakes. Remove fish. For marinade, stir in oil, parsley, sweet red pepper, onion, and mustard. Pour over fish. Cover; chill 4 to 24 hours. Shake well. Pour marinade over fish. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 173)

recipes.title: Poached Fish with Dill Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 173

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. In a fish poacher or a large roasting pan that has a wire rack with handles, add enough water to almost reach the handles. Remove the rack. Add 3 lemon slices, bay leaf, 1/4 teaspoon dried tarragon, crushed, and grease rack; set aside. Add 3 lemon slices over pan top. Cover pan, set over two burners on range; bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Lower fish on rack into pan. Simmer, covered, 35 to 40 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove fish; keep warm. Reserve 1 cup of cooking liquid for the sauce.

For dill sauce, in a saucepan cook 1/4 cup dillweed, snipped; 1/2 teaspoon dried dillweed; 1/4 teaspoon sugar. Cook in 4 tablespoons margarine or butter. Stir in 4 teaspoons all-purpose flour; 1/2 teaspoon dried dillweed. Add reserved liquid, stir about 1/2 cup of the mixture into 1 beaten egg yolk; return to saucepan. Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Pass sauce with fish. Serves 6.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 173)

recipes.title: Trout Amandine
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 174
recipes.description: The perfect recipe for freshly caught trout. The fillets in your freezer also taste great pan-fried your catch of the day.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen dressed rainbow trout or other fish fillets (about 8 oz each)

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Bone fish if desired. Combine flour and salt.
Coat fish with flour mixture. Dip in egg mixture, then coat with flour mixture again.

In a 12-inch skillet heat oil. Fry fish on one side for 5 to 6 minutes or till golden. Fry fish on the other side for 5 to 6 minutes more or till fish flakes easily. Remove fish; keep warm in a 300° oven while frying remaining fish.
For almond sauce, in a medium saucepan stir together almonds, margarine, and lemon juice over fish. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 174)

recipes.title: Pan-Fried Fish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 174
recipes.description: The crispy coating seals in the fresh fish flavor.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets (1/4 to 1 inch thick)
cornmeal or fine dry bread crumbs
shortening or cooking oil for frying

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. Cut into serving-size portions. Pat dry. In a shallow dish, mix egg and 2 tablespoons water. In another dish, mix cornmeal or bread crumbs, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and dash pepper. Dip fish into egg mixture, then coat with cornmeal mixture.

In a large skillet heat 1/4 inch melted shortening or oil. Add fish in a single layer. (If fillets have skin, fry skin side last.) Fry fish on one side till golden. Allow 3 to 4 minutes per side for 1/2-inch-thick fillets (5 to 6 minutes per side for 3/4-inch-thick fillets). Turn carefully. Fry till golden and fish flakes easily with a fork. Dry on paper towels. Keep fish warm in a 300° oven while frying remaining fish. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Curried Pan-Fried Fish: Prepare as above, except add 1 tablespoon lemon or lime juice and 2 teaspoons curry powder to cornmeal mixture. Serve with chutney.
Potato-Chip Pan-Fried Fish: Prepare as above, except substitute finely crushed potato chips or saltine crackers for the cornmeal.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 174)

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Stir-Fried Fish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen monkfish steaks, cut into pieces or cubed

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch pieces. Combine pineapple, reserving 2 tablespoons juice.

In a large skillet or wok, combine sugar, cornstarch, reserved pineapple juice, sherry, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, and 1/4 cup water. Add pineapple, cook and stir till bubbly. Stir in fish and green onions. Cook, uncovered, for 3 to 5 minutes or till fish flakes easily. Stir frequently. Remove fish and vegetables.
Serve over hot cooked rice. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 175)

recipes.title: Fish and Chips
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175

ingredients.item: shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. For chips, cut 3 peeled medium potatoes lengthwise into 3/8-inch-wide sticks. Pat dry.

In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying to 375°. Fry potatoes in hot fat, about one-third at a time, for 4 to 6 minutes or till lightly browned. Remove from fat. Drain on paper towels. Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying fish.

Pat fish dry with paper towels. Cut into serving-size pieces. For batter, combine 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 cup beer or milk, beat till smooth. Dip fish into batter. Fry fish in hot fat, 2 or 3 pieces at a time, about 2 minutes or till golden brown, about 2 minutes on each side or till golden brown. Drain; keep warm in oven while frying remaining fish. Serve with malt or cider vinegar, if desired. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 175)

recipes.title: Creamed Tuna
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Stir in tuna. Heat through. Serve over English muffin halves. If desired, sprinkle with almonds. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 175)

recipes.title: Hot Tuna Sandwich Cups
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175

ingredients.item: can tuna, drained and flaked (water pack)

instructions.text: Separate biscuits. Grease the outside of six 6-ounce custard cups. Press one biscuit over bottom and halfway down side of each custard cup, forming a biscuit cup. Place cups, biscuit side up, on a 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake in a 400° oven 7 minutes or till lightly browned. Remove biscuits from cups. Place upright in baking pan.

Meanwhile, in saucepan cook celery and onion in margarine till tender. Stir in mayonnaise, mustard, tuna, half of cheese, and the peas. Spoon tuna mixture immediately; remove biscuit from pan. Top with tomato slices and remaining cheese. Bake 2 to 3 minutes more or till cheese melts. Serves 6.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 175)

recipes.title: Tuna-Noodle Casserole
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 176
recipes.description: Homestyle cooking at its best.

ingredients.item: can condensed cream of mushroom soup
can chunk-style tuna, drained and broken into chunks

instructions.text: Cook noodles according to package directions; drain and set aside. Meanwhile, in a saucepan cook celery and onion in margarine or butter till tender. Stir in tuna or salmon; pimiento. Gently stir in cooked noodles. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Transfer to a 1 1/2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake in a 375° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till bubbly. Garnish with parsley sprigs, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Vegetable Tuna-Noodle Casserole: Prepare as above except stir in 1 cup cooked vegetable (such as peas, carrots, or green beans) with the tuna.

Extra-Creamy Tuna-Noodle Casserole: Prepare as above except substitute one 8-ounce carton dairy sour cream or substitute one 8-ounce carton plain yogurt for the milk. Stir 1 to 2 tablespoons milk into mixture, if necessary, to obtain desired consistency.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 176)

recipes.title: Tuna-Broccoli Crepes
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 176
recipes.description: Special enough for company.

ingredients.item: can tuna, drained and flaked or one 7 1/2-ounce can salmon, drained, flaked, and skin and bones removed

instructions.text: Cook broccoli according to package directions. Drain. Cut up any large broccoli pieces. Set aside.

For cheese sauce, in a medium saucepan cook onion in margarine or butter till tender but not brown. Stir in flour, mustard, and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add cheese. Cook and stir till melted and blended. Remove from heat.

Combine broccoli and 3/4 cup of the tuna sauce. Spoon about 3 tablespoons of the tuna mixture onto the unbrowned side of each crepe; roll up. Place crepes, seam side down, in a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Bake, covered, in a 375° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till heated through.

Reheat the remaining cheese sauce. Stir in additional milk, if necessary, to obtain desired consistency. To serve, spoon remaining cheese sauce over crepes. Sprinkle with paprika and, if desired, top with toasted almonds. Makes 6 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 176)

recipes.title: Tuna-Biscuit Casseroles
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 177
recipes.description: Biscuits are refrigerated biscuits.

instructions.text: Cook onion in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, bouillon granules, thyme, and pepper. Add milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in vegetables, tuna, and parsley. Heat through.

Spoon mixture into six 10-ounce casseroles or custard cups. Quarter each biscuit. Arrange 6 to 7 pieces atop each casserole. Place on baking sheet. Bake in a 400° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till biscuits are lightly browned. Makes 6 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 177)

recipes.title: Salmon Loaf
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 177
recipes.description: No time for the sauce? Cook a package of frozen peas and onions to take over the loaf.

ingredients.item: can pink salmon, bones removed, drained and flaked
cans tuna, drained, flaked, and two 6 1/2-ounce cans American cheese slices

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion, dillweed, and a dash pepper in margarine till onion is tender. Combine onion mixture, milk, and egg. Stir in salmon, bread crumbs. Shape mixture into a 6x3-inch loaf in a greased shallow baking pan. Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes. Top with Cheese Sauce or 2 American cheese slices, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 177)

recipes.title: Salmon-Pasta Skillet
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 177

ingredients.item: pitted ripe olives, cut into cubes

instructions.text: In a large skillet bring chicken broth to boiling. Add pasta. Cook, covered, 15 to 20 minutes or till pasta is tender, stirring frequently. Add broth and salmon. Cook, covered, about 3 more minutes. Stir in cheese, peas, and olives. Cook, covered, about 3 minutes more. Gently stir in salmon. Heat through. Sprinkle with lemon peel. Pass Parmesan cheese. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 177)

recipes.title: Lobster Newburg
recipes.description: The rich Madeira-flavored sauce enhances the delicate taste of lobster.

ingredients.prep_note: 5-ounce cans, drained, and broken into bite-size pieces

instructions.text: In a saucepan melt margarine or butter. Stir in flour, salt, and red pepper. Add cream all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Stir about half of the hot mixture into the beaten egg yolks; return all to saucepan.

Cook and stir over low heat about 2 minutes or till mixture just begins to thicken and bubble slightly. Stir in Madeira or dry sherry. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Add lobster; heat through. Serve in patty shells, if desired, or over toast points. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Crab Newburg: Prepare as above, except substitute 2 cups cooked crabmeat for the lobster. Garnish with parsley sprigs.
Shrimp Newburg: Prepare as above, except substitute two 6-ounce packages frozen, peeled, cooked shrimp, thawed and drained, for the lobster.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 184)

recipes.title: Boiled Lobster

instructions.text: In a 12-quart Dutch oven bring 8 quarts water and 1 1/2 to 2 teaspoons salt to boiling. Use two 1- to 1 1/2-pound live lobsters. Grasp each lobster just behind the eyes; rinse lobsters under cold running water.
Quickly plunge lobsters headfirst into the boiling water. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Drain lobsters.
Remove the green tomalley (liver). Set aside and serve with the lobster meat, if desired.

notes: Using kitchen shears, halve the body lengthwise up to the tail.
Cut and Remove the black vein running through the tail and the small sac near the head. (Found only in female lobsters.)

Remove the green tomalley (liver) and, if present, the roe. Mash the tomalley and roe. Make a Clarified Butter: Melt 1/2 cup butter over very low heat without stirring; cool slightly. Pour off clear top layer. Discard milky bottom layer.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 184)

recipes.title: Marinated Salmon Steaks
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut steaks into serving-size portions. For marinating, in a shallow dish, combine lime peel, lemon or lime juice, oil, Worcestershire sauce, rosemary or thyme, garlic, and pepper.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen salmon (or halibut) steaks, 1 inch thick
finely shredded lemon, lime or orange peel

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut steaks into serving-size portions. For marinating, in a shallow dish, combine lime peel, lemon or lime juice, oil, Worcestershire sauce, rosemary or thyme, garlic, and pepper.

Place fish in marinade, turning to coat. Cover; marinate fish in the refrigerator for 30 minutes or till fish is opaque, turning steaks occasionally. Add 1 tablespoon water, if necessary, to keep fish moist.

Drain fish, reserving marinade. Place fish steaks on a greased unheated rack of a broiler pan. Brush with marinade. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 5 minutes. Using a wide spatula, carefully turn fish over. Brush with marinade. Broil for 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

notes: Grill directions: Place fish steaks on a greased grill rack. Grill directly over medium-hot coals for 5 minutes. Using a wide spatula, carefully turn fish. Grill for 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

recipes.title: Halibut with Sherry Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen halibut or other fish steaks, cut 1 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Place fish on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan. Sprinkle with pepper. Broil 4 inches from the heat 5 minutes. Turn fish. Brush with remaining margarine. Broil 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan stir together sour cream, milk, mustard, chives, and a dash pepper. Cook till hot (do not boil). Serve over fish.

recipes.title: Dijon-Mustard Fillets
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. Place fish on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from the heat till fish flakes easily per 1/2-inch thickness (Allow 4 to 6 minutes per 1/2-inch thickness). Turn once if more than 1 inch thick.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan stir together sour cream, milk, mustard, chives, and a dash pepper. Cook till hot (do not boil). Serve over fish.

recipes.title: Teriyaki Shark
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Use 1 pound fresh or frozen shark, swordfish, tuna, or halibut steaks, cut 1 inch thick.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen shark, swordfish, tuna, or halibut steaks, cut 1 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Place fish on greased unheated rack of broiler pan. Combine seasoning; rub onto fish. Cover; chill for 30 minutes to 2 hours. Brush with melted margarine or butter.
Broil 4 inches from the heat for 5 minutes. Turn fish. Brush with remaining margarine. Broil for 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

recipes.title: Swordfish Kabobs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Swordfish, tuna, or shark make great kabobs because of their firm, meatlike texture.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen swordfish, tuna, or shark steaks, cut 1 inch thick
large green onions, cut into 2-inch lengths
finely shredded orange or cherry tomato peel

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut into 1-inch cubes. Place fish, mushrooms, and onions in a plastic bag; set bag into a bowl. Combine oil, wine, garlic, orange peel, and 1/4 teaspoon salt; add to bag. Seal bag and marinate at room temperature for 2 hours, turning bag occasionally. Drain fish and vegetables for 30 minutes.

On eight 12-inch skewers alternately thread fish cubes, mushrooms, and onions, leaving about 1/4 inch between pieces. Place kabobs on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Turn kabobs over. Broil for 4 to 6 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Brush again with sauce during the last 2 minutes of grilling. Brush again with sauce before serving.

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Fish Kabobs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Complete this Oriental-style meal with fried rice and buttered green peas.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen swordfish, sea bass, shark, or tuna steaks, cut 1 inch thick
medium green or sweet red pepper, cut into 6 or 8 medium-size chunks

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch cubes. Cook fish in a small amount of boiling salted water for 10 to 12 minutes or till nearly cooked. (Cook and stir for 10 minutes if the sauce is very thick). Drain.

For the sauce, in a small bowl combine 1/4 cup of pineapple juice, preserves, and lemon juice, leaving the rest for another use. Add fish cubes and 1/4 inch between alternately thread fish, leaving about 1/4 inch between pieces. Place kabobs on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 5 minutes. Turn pan. Broil for 4 to 5 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork, brushing with sauce during the last 2 minutes of broiling. Brush again with sauce before serving.

recipes.title: Blackened Redfish
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Stand back! This Cajun specialty really smokes as it cooks. That's why it's best to grill it outdoors.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen redfish or other fish fillets (about 1/2 inch thick)

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. Place some of the melted margarine on a cast-iron skilled grill rack; sprinkle evenly on both sides of fish for some of the melt 12-inch well-seasoned cast-iron skillet. Heat until very hot, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, brush fish with remaining margarine.
Place fish in pan. Cook, uncovered, over high, for 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 minutes per side or till fish flakes easily with a fork, turning once. Serve with lemon wedges.

recipes.title: Fish with Beer-Cheese Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The tangy cheese sauce tastes great over catfish, halibut, flounder, or sole fillets or steaks.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets or steaks

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. In a lightly greased 10x6x2-inch baking dish, arrange fish in a single layer, tucking under thin edges. Bake in a 450° oven for 4 to 6 minutes per 1/2-inch thickness or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

Meanwhile, for sauce, cook onion in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, a pinch salt, and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add cheese and, if desired, caraway seed. Stir till cheese melts. Stir in beer. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Add cheese and beer; cook and stir till cheese melts. Spoon over fish.

recipes.title: Citrus Baked Halibut
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen halibut steaks, chopped onion

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Arrange fish in an 8x8x2-inch baking dish. Cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in paprika. Spread over fish. Pour lemon juice over all. Cover with vented plastic wrap or foil. Bake in a 400° oven for 7 to 9 minutes or till fish is done, giving dish a half-turn once. Serve as above.

recipes.title: Broccoli-Stuffed Sole
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen sole or other skinless fish fillets (about 1/4 inch thick)
cheese with chives and onion, softened

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. For stuffing, cook and drain broccoli. In a saucepan cook broccoli; milk, and wine till heated through. Stir in cheese; add to Parmesan cheese. Stir till end cheese melts. Spread stuffing onto end of each fillet. Roll up. Place, seam side down, in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till fish is cooked and stuffing is hot. Serve with lemon wedges, if desired. Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

recipes.title: Baked Fish with Mushrooms
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets or steaks, cut 1/2 to 3/4 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Arrange fish in a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish, turning under thin edges. Sprinkle with mushrooms, onion, and tarragon in margarine till tender. Spoon over fish; sprinkle with paprika. Bake, covered, in a 450° oven for 6 to 10 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

recipes.title: Wild-Rice-Stuffed Fish
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Two mid-western delicacies—wild rice and whitefish—from the Great Lakes region. Combine them for a memorable entrée.

ingredients.item: dressed whitefish or other fish (about 2 to 2 1/2 pounds)

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Rinse rice thoroughly; drain. In a medium saucepan cook mushrooms, onion, and garlic in margarine or butter. Stir in broth, sherry, and lemon peel. Cover and simmer for 45 to 60 minutes or till rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Stir in pimiento.
Place fish in a well-greased large, shallow baking pan. Spoon stuffing into fish cavity; press lightly to flatten. Cover with foil.
Bake fish in a 350° oven for 30 to 40 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Use two large spatulas to transfer fish to a serving plate.

missing_inputs: Not in database: finely chopped pimiento

recipes.title: Fish en Papillote
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: En papillote (pah-pee-YOHT) is French for 'in paper.' It's a simple yet elegant way to cook fish.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen skinless pompano, perch, sole, or flounder fish fillets (about 1/2 inch thick)

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut 4 pieces of parchment paper into heart shapes, 12 inches wide and 9 inches long. In a large skillet bring water, lemon slices, bay leaf, and bouillon granules to boiling; add fish in a single layer. Return liquid to boiling. Simmer, covered, for 4 to 6 minutes or till fish flakes easily. Using a slotted spoon, remove fish.

For sauce, in the same skillet cook carrot and onion in margarine till tender. Stir in flour and mustard. Add reserved liquid. Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Add milk. Cook and stir till mixture boils. Cook and stir 1 minute more.

To assemble each packet, place one fillet on half of each parchment heart. Top with one-fourth of the sauce. Fold the other half of the heart over fillet. Starting at the top, seal by turning up edges of heart and folding in tightly; twist tip of heart to seal. Place packets on a large baking sheet. Bake in a 400° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till slightly puffed. Transfer to dinner plates. To serve, cut an X in top of each. Pull back the paper.

missing_inputs: Not in database: parchment paper or brown paper

recipes.title: Chilled Salmon Steaks
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Serve with Tartar Sauce (see page 367).

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen salmon or halibut steaks, cut 3/4 to 1 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Add fish to boiling Court Bouillon or water. Return to boiling. Simmer, covered, 8 to 12 minutes or till fish flakes easily with fork.
Remove fish. For marinade, combine oil in a screwcap jar with milk. Shake well. Pour over fish and vegetables. Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours. Spoon marinade over fish occasionally. Drain.

Court Bouillon: Simmer 2 cups water, 1 sliced celery stalk, 1 medium carrot, sliced, 2 tablespoons sliced onion, 1 bay leaf, 3 whole peppercorns, and 1/4 teaspoon salt, covered, 8 cups water for 30 minutes. Strain.

recipes.title: Poached Fish with Dill Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. In a fish poacher or a large roasting pan that has a wire rack with handles, add enough water to almost reach the rack. Add bay leaf, tarragon, and 3 lemon slices. Place pan over two burners on range top. Bring to boiling.
Lower fish on rack into pan. Simmer, covered, for 35 to 40 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove fish. Keep warm. Reserve 1 cup cooking liquid.
For dill sauce, cooking liquid. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon dried dillweed, 1/2 teaspoon sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and dash pepper. Stir in 1 beaten egg yolk; return to saucepan. Cook and stir till bubbly.

missing_inputs: Not in database: fresh or frozen dressed fish

recipes.title: Vegetable-Topped Fillets
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Serve a colorful zucchini, squash, but use just summer squash if you wish.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen sole, orange roughy, or other fish fillets (about 1/2 inch thick)

instructions.text: In a large skillet bring chicken broth just to boiling. Carefully add fish. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer 4 to 6 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

Meanwhile, in another skillet cook vegetables and savory over medium-high heat in oil till vegetables are tender-crisp. Drain. Add remaining vegetables. Cook 4 to 6 minutes more or till vegetables are crisp-tender. Sprinkle with pepper. Spoon vegetables over fish.

missing_inputs: Not in database: dried summer savory, crushed

recipes.title: Trout Amandine
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The perfect recipe for freshly caught pan-dressed fish—your catch of the day or frozen market fish.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen pan-dressed trout or other fish (about 8 ounces each)

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Bone fish, if desired. Stir together egg and milk. Stir together flour and salt. Dip fish into egg mixture, then into flour mixture.

Cook fish in hot oil for 5 to 6 minutes per side or till golden, skin side up. Fry fish on one side until golden. Turn and fry on the other side till golden. Remove fish to a serving platter; keep warm.
Melt margarine in same skillet; stir in almonds. Cook and stir till almonds are lightly browned. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Spoon over fish.

recipes.title: Pan-Fried Fish
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The crispy coating seals in the fresh fish flavor.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets (1/4 to 1 inch thick)
cornmeal or fine dry bread crumbs
shortening or cooking oil for frying

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. Cut into serving-size portions. Pat dry. In a shallow dish combine egg and 2 tablespoons water. In another dish, mix cornmeal or bread crumbs, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and dash pepper. Dip fish into egg mixture, then coat with cornmeal mixture.
Dip both sides of the fish fillets into the egg mixture, then into the cornmeal mixture.
Fry the fish in hot oil on one side till golden. Turn and cook on the other side.

notes: Sole Amandine: Prepare as above, except use sole, flounder, or orange roughy fillets for the pan-dressed fish. Reduce fish to 1 tablespoon. Cook fish 3 to 4 minutes on each side.
Curried Pan-Fried Fish: Prepare as above, except add 1 teaspoon curry powder to cornmeal mixture. Serve with chutney.
Potato-Chip Pan-Fried Fish: Prepare as above, except add 2 teaspoons lemon or lime juice to egg mixture and substitute finely crushed potato chips or saltine crackers for the cornmeal.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil for frying (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Stir-Fried Fish
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen monkfish, cusk, or catfish steaks, cut 3/4 to 1 inch thick
medium green pepper, cut into 3/4-inch squares

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut into 1-inch pieces. Drain pineapple, reserving 1/2 cup juice. For sauce, in a small bowl stir together reserved pineapple juice, brown sugar, cornstarch, vinegar, and soy sauce; set aside.

Add fish to wok or large skillet over high heat. Stir-fry fish for 3 to 5 minutes or till fish flakes easily with fork. Stir sauce; add to wok. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in pineapple and vegetables. Cook and stir till heated through. Serve over rice.

recipes.title: Fish and Chips
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. For chips, cut 3 peeled medium potatoes lengthwise into 3/8-inch-wide sticks. Pat dry. In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches melted shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying to 375°. Fry potatoes, one-third at a time, for 4 to 6 minutes or till lightly browned. Remove; keep warm in a 300° oven while frying remaining fish. Drain; keep warm in 300° oven while frying fish.

Pat fish dry with paper towels. Cut into serving-size pieces. Flour fish. For batter, combine 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 cup beer or milk, beat till smooth. Dip fish into batter. Fry fish in hot fat, 2 or 3 pieces at a time, for 2 minutes. Fry fish in hot fat, 2 or 3 pieces at time, about 2 minutes or till golden brown, about 2 minutes. Drain; keep warm with malt or cider vinegar, if desired.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for malt vinegar or cider vinegar

recipes.title: Creamed Tuna
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Try this old favorite served over cooked noodles.

ingredients.item: can tuna (water pack), drained and broken into chunks

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion in margarine till tender. Stir in sour cream, wine, flour, dill, and pepper. Cook and stir till bubbly. Stir in tuna; heat through (do not boil). Serve over muffins. Sprinkle with almonds.

missing_inputs: Not in database: English muffins, split and toasted

recipes.title: Hot Tuna Sandwich Cups
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: can tuna (water pack), drained and flaked

instructions.text: Separate biscuits. Grease the outside of six 6-ounce custard cups. Press one biscuit down side of each custard cup. Place cups, dough side up, on a 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake in a 400° oven 7 minutes or till lightly browned.
Meanwhile, in saucepan combine tuna, celery, and onion in margarine till tender. Stir in mayonnaise, mustard, and half of the cheese. Remove from heat.

Remove biscuit cups from oven. Immediately remove from cups. Place upright in baking pan. Spoon tuna mixture into cups. Top with tomato slices and remaining cheese. Bake 2 to 3 minutes more or till cheese melts.

missing_inputs: Not in database: package (6) refrigerated biscuits

recipes.title: Tuna-Noodle Casserole
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Here's an old-time cooking at its best.

ingredients.item: condensed cream of mushroom or celery soup
tuna, drained and broken into chunks, or two 6 1/2-ounce cans boneless, skinless salmon, drained and broken into chunks

instructions.text: Cook noodles according to package directions; drain. Meanwhile, in a saucepan cook celery and onion in margarine or butter till tender. Stir in tuna or salmon. Stir in soup, milk. Gently stir in tuna or salmon pimiento. Add 1 1/2 cooked noodles. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake in a 350° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till bubbly. Sprinkle with parsley, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Vegetable Tuna-Noodle Casserole: Prepare as above, except stir in 1 cup cooked vegetables with noodles. Sprinkle with Parmesan and, if desired, garnish with parsley.

Extra-Creamy Tuna-Noodle Casserole: Prepare as above except substitute one 8-ounce carton dairy sour cream or substitute one 8-ounce carton plain yogurt for the milk. Stir 1 to 2 tablespoons milk into mixture, if necessary, to obtain desired consistency.

recipes.title: Tuna-Broccoli Crepes
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Special enough for company.

ingredients.item: can tuna, drained and flaked, or one 6 1/2-ounce can crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed

instructions.text: Cook broccoli according to package directions. Drain. Cut up any large broccoli pieces. Set aside.

For cheese sauce, in a medium saucepan cook onion in margarine or butter till tender but not browned. Stir in flour, mustard, and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add cheese. Cook and stir till cheese melts.

Combine tuna or salmon and 3/4 cup of the sauce. Spoon about 3 tablespoons of the tuna mixture onto the unbrowned side of each crepe; roll up. Place crepes, seam side down, in a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Bake, covered, in a 375° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till heated through.
Reheat the remaining cheese sauce. Stir in additional milk, if necessary. To serve, spoon remaining cheese sauce over crepes. Sprinkle with paprika and, if desired, top with toasted almonds.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Crepes (see recipe, page 72)
assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for sliced or slivered almonds, toasted (optional)

recipes.title: Tuna-Biscuit Casseroles
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Biscuits top this creamy tuna mixture.

instructions.text: In a large skillet bring chicken broth to boiling. Cook onion in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, thyme, and bouillon. Add milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in peas, rice, Parmesan, and tuna. Cook, uncovered, on oven and biscuits in canned, in 3 custard cups or ramekins. Cut biscuits in half. Place 2 halves, cut side down, atop each. Bake in a 400° oven about 20 minutes or till biscuits are golden brown.

recipes.title: Salmon Loaf
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: No time for this sauce? Cook a package of frozen creamed peas and onions to ladle over the loaf.

ingredients.item: can pink salmon, drained, bones removed, and broken into small chunks, or two 6 1/2-ounce cans tuna, drained, or 2 American cheese slices (optional)

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion, dillweed, and a dash pepper in margarine till onion is tender. Combine egg, bread crumbs, milk, and onion mixture. Add salmon; mix well. Shape into a 6x3-inch loaf in a greased shallow baking pan. Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes. Top with Cheese Sauce or 2 American cheese slices, if desired.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for Cheese Sauce (see recipe, page 361) (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Salmon-Pasta Skillet
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: vegetables broccoli flowerets or frozen mixed

instructions.text: In a large skillet bring chicken broth to boiling. Cook pasta according to package directions, cooking 15 to 20 minutes or till pasta is tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in peas and vegetables. Simmer for 1 minute more. Add Parmesan, cream cheese spread, salmon, and salt. Cook until heated through, stirring occasionally.

recipes.title: Fettuccine with Cheese Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 158
recipes.description: Elegant for entertaining.

ingredients.item: packaged fettuccine, linguine, or egg noodles
shredded process Swiss, Gruyère, or American cheese

instructions.text: Cook fettuccine according to package directions (or see chart, page 278); drain well.

Meanwhile, for cheese sauce, in a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, bouillon granules, and the 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till slightly thickened and bubbly. Add shredded cheese; stir till melted.
Stir in cheese. Cook and stir till cheese melts. Stir in parsley. If cheese sauce is too thick, stir in 1 to 2 tablespoons additional milk.
Serve cheese sauce over hot cooked pasta. Sprinkle with freshly ground pepper. Serves 4.

notes: Fettuccine with Broccoli and Cheese Sauce: Prepare as above, except add one 10-ounce package frozen chopped broccoli to pasta after it has simmered for 5 minutes.

Fettuccine with Asparagus and Swiss Cheese Sauce: Prepare as above, except add one 10-ounce package frozen cut asparagus to pasta after it has simmered for 5 minutes. For sauce, use the process Swiss cheese. Substitute 2 tablespoons toasted sliced almonds for the freshly ground pepper.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Macaroni and Cheese
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 160
recipes.description: For homemade flavor in a hurry, try the Shortcut Macaroni and Cheese.

instructions.text: Cook macaroni according to package directions (or see chart, page 278); drain well.

Meanwhile, for cheese sauce, in a saucepan cook onion in margarine or butter till tender but not brown. Stir in flour and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till slightly thickened and bubbly. Add shredded cheese; stir till melted.

Stir macaroni into cheese sauce. Transfer to a 1-quart casserole. Bake, uncovered, in a 350° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till bubbly. During the last 5 minutes of baking, arrange tomato slices atop macaroni, if desired. Let stand 10 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Vegetable Macaroni and Cheese: Prepare as above, except stir 2 cups frozen mixed vegetables, thawed, or one 16-ounce can mixed vegetables, drained, into cheese sauce with macaroni. Transfer to a 1 1/2-quart casserole.

Shortcut Macaroni and Cheese: Prepare as above, except immediately return the drained macaroni to the saucepan it was cooked in. Pour the cheese sauce over the macaroni; mix well. Cook over low heat for 3 to 5 minutes or till heated through, stirring frequently. Let stand for 10 minutes.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Fettuccine with Cheese Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Elegant for entertaining.

ingredients.item: packaged fettuccine, linguine, or egg noodles
shredded process Swiss, Gruyère, or American cheese (6 ounces)

instructions.text: Cook fettuccine according to package directions (or see chart, page 278). Drain; keep warm.

For cheese sauce, in a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, bouillon granules, and the 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more.
Stir in cheese. Cook and stir till cheese melts. Stir in parsley. If cheese sauce is too thick, stir in 1 to 2 tablespoons additional milk.
Serve cheese sauce over hot cooked pasta. Sprinkle with freshly ground pepper. Serves 4.

notes: Microwave directions: Cook fettuccine as above. For cheese sauce, in a 4-cup measure micro-cook onion, garlic, and margarine or butter on 100% power (high) for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or till onion is tender. Stir in flour, bouillon granules, and the 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add milk. Stir to combine. Cook on high for 3 to 5 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute till the sauce starts to thicken, then every 30 seconds. Cook for 30 seconds more. Add cheese; stir till melted. If necessary, cook on high for 15 to 30 seconds or till cheese melts. Serve as above.
Fettuccine with Broccoli and Cheese Sauce: Prepare as above, except add one 10-ounce package frozen chopped broccoli to pasta after it has simmered for 5 minutes.

Fettuccine with Asparagus and Swiss Cheese Sauce: Prepare as above, except add one 10-ounce package frozen cut asparagus to pasta after it has simmered for 5 minutes. For sauce, use the process Swiss cheese. Substitute 2 tablespoons toasted sliced almonds for the freshly ground pepper.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Creole Stuffed Roast
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 228

instructions.text: For stuffing, in a mixing bowl combine onion, green pepper, garlic, celery seed, black pepper, and red pepper. Set aside. Cut tied pork roast and separate. Trim fat. Cut slits along the flat side of one half of roast.

Fill slits with some of the stuffing. Place meat, cut side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Insert a meat thermometer. Roast in a 325° oven for 1 1/4 to 1 3/4 hours. Cover and let stand 15 minutes before carving.

recipes.title: Rice-Stuffed Rib Crown Roast
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 228
recipes.description: Sides of ribs form an impressive roast.

ingredients.item: pork rib back ribs (16 to 20 ribs)

instructions.text: To form roast, tie 2 or 3 slabs of ribs together, rib side out and double-bone end up, forming a circle about 5 inches in diameter with crown leaving the inside shallow roasting pan. Rub the inside of the crown. If desired, sprinkle meat thermometer in a 450° oven for 20 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350°. Brush roast.

Meanwhile, for stuffing, in a saucepan combine water, rice, carrot, corn syrup, salt, and the 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Spoon stuffing into crown of roast, transfer meat to a serving platter. Using a fork to steady, cut between the ribs. Make 6 to 8 servings.

notes: Fruit-Stuffed Rib Crown Roast: Prepare as above, except instead of rice stuffing, add one 6-ounce package dried fruit bits and 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon with the rice.

missing_inputs: Not in database: dried Italian seasoning

recipes.title: Harvest Pot Roast
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 229

ingredients.item: medium acorn squash, peeled and sliced

instructions.text: Trim fat from meat. If desired, sprinkle meat with salt and pepper. In Dutch oven brown meat on all sides in hot oil. Drain fat. Add onion, bouillon, bay leaf, 1 1/4 cups water, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 25 to 30 minutes.

Add squash. Cook until meat is done, about 1 hour. Cut squash in half; remove seeds. Cut each half into 4 pieces. Add squash and potatoes to Dutch oven. Simmer 25 to 30 minutes more till vegetables are done.

Transfer meat and vegetables to platter; keep warm. Discard bay leaf. Skim fat from drippings. Measure 1 1/2 cups liquid; return to pan. For gravy, stir 1/4 cup cold water into flour. Stir into pan juices. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly; cook 1 minute more. Serve with meat and vegetables. Makes 4 servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Roast Pork with Mushroom-Butter Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 229

ingredients.item: boneless pork roast, rolled and tied

instructions.text: For stuffing, combine mushrooms, onions, and green onions. In a skillet cook mushrooms, salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in margarine till liquid evaporates. Remove from heat. Stir in wine, parsley, lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.

Trim fat from roast. Make 8 pockets, about 1/4 inch deep, in meat. Spoon stuffing into pockets. Place roast, rib side down, in a shallow roasting pan. Insert meat thermometer. Roast in a 325° oven for 2 to 3 hours or till thermometer registers 170°. Cover; let stand 15 minutes before carving. Serve with Mushroom-Butter Sauce.

recipes.title: Pork with Apple-Nutmeg Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 230
recipes.description: Drizzle this tasty cider sauce over meat.

ingredients.item: boneless pork loin center rib roast

instructions.text: Trim fat from meat. If desired, sprinkle meat with salt and pepper. Place rib side down, in a shallow roasting pan. Insert a meat thermometer. Roast in a 325° oven for 1 1/4 to 1 3/4 hours or till thermometer registers 170° (well-done). Cover and let stand 15 minutes before carving.

For sauce, in a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in corn, apple, bouillon granules, nutmeg, and pepper. Add apple cider and stir 1 minute. Cook and stir more. Serve sauce over meat. Serves 8 to 10.

recipes.title: Citrus-Glazed Ribs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 230

instructions.text: Cut ribs into serving-size pieces. Place ribs, bone side down, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan.

Roast in a 350° oven for 1 hour. Drain. Meanwhile, for orange combine soy sauce, 2 tablespoons marmalade, lemon juice, and 3/4 teaspoon ground ginger. Roast 30 to 45 minutes more or till well-done. Brush occasionally with glaze. Brush with any remaining glaze before serving. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Barbecue-Style Ribs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 230

instructions.text: Place ribs, bone side down, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Bake in a 350° oven for 1 hour. Drain.

Meanwhile, for sauce, in a small saucepan cook onion and garlic in hot oil till tender. Stir in tomato sauce, mustard, brown sugar, lemon juice, 1/4 cup water, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Simmer, uncovered, for 15 to 20 minutes or till slightly thickened. Stir in ribs. Bake ribs, covered, for 30 to 60 minutes more or till well-done, brushing occasionally with sauce. Pass remaining sauce with ribs. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Braised Steaks Italian
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 230

ingredients.item: pork shoulder blade steaks, cut 1/2 to 3/4 inch thick (2 to 2 1/2 pounds)

instructions.text: Trim fat from meat. In a large skillet brown 2 steaks on each side. Remove steaks from skillet; cook for 2 steaks and remove. Add onion to oil remaining in skillet for 2 minutes. Drain. Add pizza sauce. Return steaks to skillet.

Cover; simmer for low heat about 30 minutes or till no pink remains. Remove steaks. Skim fat from pan juices. If necessary, continue cooking juices to thicken slightly. Spoon over meat. Serve with remaining glaze. Serves 4 to 6.

missing_inputs: Not in database: can pizza sauce

recipes.title: Corn-Stuffed Pork Chops
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 231
recipes.description: Savory stuffed pork chops stuffed with a buttery corn and vegetable filling.

ingredients.item: pork loin rib chops or pork loin butterfly chops, cut 1 1/4 inches thick (about 2 pounds)
corn-bread stuffing mix or herb-seasoned stuffing mix

instructions.text: Trim fat from chops. Cut a pocket in each chop by cutting from fat side almost to the bone to make a pocket for the stuffing.

For the stuffing, cook vegetables in margarine till tender but not brown, stirring occasionally. In a small saucepan cook onion and green pepper in margarine till tender. Spoon stuffing into pockets with each pork chop. Secure pockets with wooden toothpicks. Place chops on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Cover with foil.
Bake in a 375° oven for 40 to 45 minutes. Uncover; continue cooking for 10 to 15 minutes more or till pork is no pink remains. Remove picks. Makes 4 servings.

missing_inputs: Not in database: tablespoons chopped pimiento

ingredients.item: boneless veal leg top round steak, veal sirloin steak, or pork

instructions.text: Cut veal into 4 pieces. With a meat mallet, pound each piece to 1/4-inch thickness. If desired, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Coat with flour. In a large skillet cook half of the veal over medium-high heat in 1 tablespoon of the margarine for 1 to 2 minutes on each side or till no pink remains. Keep warm. Repeat with remaining veal and 1 tablespoon margarine.

Add remaining margarine to skillet. Add mushrooms. Cook and stir over medium heat for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in sherry and bouillon. Bring to boiling; stir mixture over medium heat till reduced by half (about 30 seconds).
Spoon mushroom mixture over veal. Sprinkle with parsley. If desired, serve with hot cooked noodles. Makes 4 servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Beef Fajitas
recipes.description: Serve the most sizzling hot for a typical South Texas flair.

ingredients.item: boneless beef plate skirt steak, beef flank steak, or beef round steak
medium green or red sweet pepper, cut into thin strips
Shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese
avocado dip, chunked avocado, or Guacamole

instructions.text: Partially freeze beef; thinly slice across the grain into bite-size strips. Place strips in a plastic bag set in a deep bowl. For marinade, in a mixing bowl combine Italian salad dressing, the 1/2 cup Salsa, the lime or lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce. Pour mixture over meat and seal bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for 6 to 24 hours, stirring occasionally.

Wrap tortillas in foil. Meanwhile, in a 12-inch skillet over high heat, add oil. Cook and stir onion rings in hot oil for 1 1/2 minutes. Add sweet pepper strips; cook and stir about 1 1/2 minutes more or till crisp-tender. Remove vegetables from skillet.

Add beef and marinade to hot skillet. Cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes or till done. Remove beef and vegetables to the hot skillet. Add onion and sweet pepper with tortillas to remaining beef and vegetables in skillet for 1 to 2 minutes or till heated through. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes more to reduce or evade dip, sour cream, cheese, and additional Salsa. Roll up fajitas. Makes 4 servings.

missing_inputs: Recipe data incomplete for nutrition calculation

ingredients.item: beef tenderloin steak or sirloin steak
sliced fresh mushrooms or button mushrooms

instructions.text: Partially freeze beef. Thinly slice across the grain into bite-size strips. Toss beef strips with flour and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Set aside.

In a large skillet cook mushrooms, onion, and garlic in margarine over high heat till tender. Add 1/4 cup of the broth. Stir to scrape up any drippings. Cook till thickened, stirring constantly. Remove from skillet.

Add more margarine to skillet if necessary. Add meat; cook and stir over medium-high heat for 2 to 3 minutes or till done. Return all meat to skillet. Drain mushrooms; stir into remaining sauce. For filling, combine cooked peas and carrots, the 1 cup sauce, and chicken or turkey. Spread 1/4 cup filling over the unbrowned side of each crepe, leaving a 1/4-inch rim around edge. Roll up crepes.

ingredients.item: dairy sour cream, plain yogurt, mayonnaise, or salad dressing

ingredients.prep_note: small, halved, seed removed, peeled, and thinly sliced
American, Swiss, cheddar, or Monterey Jack

instructions.text: In a bowl mix 1/2 cup dairy sour cream, plain yogurt, mayonnaise, or salad dressing; 2 teaspoons prepared mustard; 1/2 teaspoon dried basil, crushed; and 1/8 teaspoon garlic powder.
Halve, seed, peel, and thinly slice 1 small avocado. If desired, brush avocado with lemon juice.
Split 4 individual French rolls and scoop out some of the center of each half. Spread both halves of rolls with some of the yogurt mixture.

On the bottom half of each roll, layer 1 leaf lettuce; 2 slices cooked chicken or turkey; 1 slice American, Swiss, cheddar, or Monterey Jack cheese; 3 thin slices tomato or 6 thin slices cucumber; and the avocado slices. If desired, top with alfalfa sprouts. Replace roll tops. Serves 4.

recipes.description: Roasted chicken with potatoes, carrots, and apples in a honey-mustard glaze.

ingredients.prep_note: peeled and quartered, or 6 new potatoes

instructions.text: Rinse chicken and pat dry. Skewer neck skin to back. Tie legs to tail. Twist wing tips under back. Place, breast side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Brush with oil. Roast chicken, uncovered, in a 375° oven for 1 hour.
Cook potatoes and carrots in boiling water for 20 to 25 minutes or till nearly tender. Drain.
For glaze, in a saucepan combine honey, mustard, margarine, onion, curry powder, garlic salt, red pepper, and ginger. Bring to boiling, stirring constantly. Remove from heat; set aside.

Discard fat in roasting pan. Cut apples into wedges. Arrange potatoes, carrots, and apples around chicken in the pan. Spoon glaze over poultry, vegetables, and apples. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes more or till chicken is no longer pink, the drumsticks move easily in their sockets, and the vegetables are tender. Makes 6 servings.

Roast, uncovered, in a 375° oven for 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 hours or till no longer pink and the drumsticks move easily in their sockets, brushing occasionally with drippings. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Makes 6 servings.

recipes.title: Honey and Spice Duckling

recipes.description: Roasted duck with a sweet and spicy Szechwan pepper glaze.

ingredients.prep_note: coarsely ground, or 1 teaspoon whole pepper, coarsely ground

instructions.text: Rinse duck; pat dry. In a bowl combine pepper, salt, ginger, and five-spice powder. Sprinkle body cavity of duck with some of the salt mixture; rub remaining mixture on skin of duck. Skewer neck skin to back; tie legs to tail. Twist wing tips under back. Prick skin all over with a fork.

Place duckling, breast side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Roast in a 375° oven for 1 3/4 to 2 1/4 hours or till the drumsticks move easily in their sockets and duck is no longer pink, spooning off fat occasionally. Meanwhile, mix honey and soy sauce; baste duck with honey mixture once or twice during the last 10 minutes of roasting. Makes 3 or 4 servings.

recipes.title: Stuffed Cornish Game Hens
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Elegant individual game hens stuffed with a savory bread stuffing and glazed with orange sauce.

instructions.text: Cook bacon till crisp. Remove bacon; drain and crumble. Cook carrot in drippings over medium heat till tender; remove from heat. Stir in bacon, parsley, savory, and pepper. Stir in bread cubes.
Dissolve the 1/4 teaspoon bouillon granules in 2 tablespoons hot water. Drizzle over bread mixture, tossing lightly.

Rinse hens; pat dry. Season cavities with salt. Lightly stuff hens with bread mixture. Pull neck skin, if present, to back of each hen. Twist wing tips under back, holding skin in place. Tie legs to tail.
Place hens, breast side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Brush with oil; cover loosely with foil. Roast in a 375° oven for 30 minutes.

Stir together wine, melted margarine or butter, and the 2 tablespoons orange juice; brush on hens. Roast hens, uncovered, about 1 hour more or till tender and no longer pink, brushing with wine mixture twice.

For sauce, add additional orange juice to remaining wine mixture to make 3/4 cup. In a small saucepan combine cornstarch, brown sugar, and the 1/2 teaspoon bouillon granules. Stir in wine mixture. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Serve sauce with hens. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Bacon and Double Cheese Quiche
recipes.attribution: Great American Home Baking
recipes.description: Paired with a tossed green salad, this full-flavored quiche makes an excellent lunch.

ingredients.item: chilled butter, cut into small pieces

instructions.text: To prepare the crust, in a large bowl, mix together the flour and salt. Using a pastry blender or 2 knives, cut in the butter until coarse crumbs form.
Add water, 1 tablespoon at a time, tossing with a fork, until dough forms. Shape into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap, and chill in refrigerator for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375°F. On a lightly floured surface, using a lightly floured rolling pin, roll the dough into 11-inch circle. Fit into 9-inch pie pan. Trim edge, leaving 1/2-inch overhang. Fold under to form standup edge. Prick dough with a fork. Line with foil and fill with pie weights or dried beans.
Bake for 10 minutes. Remove the foil and weights. Bake until golden, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool.
Meanwhile, prepare filling. In a medium skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel to drain.

In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, thyme, and pepper. Pour into crust. Crumble bacon. Sprinkle the egg mixture with the bacon, Gruyere cheese, and Cheddar cheese. Bake until golden and custard is set, about 30 minutes. Serve warm.

notes: To freeze: Cool baked quiche completely, wrap airtight, and freeze for up to 1 month.

Place pepper rings on top. Place sandwich halves on a shallow baking pan or on a 375° oven for 5 minutes. Top with cheese. Bake about 3 minutes more or till cheese melts. Cover with roll tops. If desired, serve with pepperoncini.

Microwave directions: In a 1½-quart casserole cook sausage, covered, on 100% power (high) for 4 to 6 minutes or till no pink remains, stirring twice. Drain. Stir in pizza sauce and mushrooms. Micro-cook, uncovered, on high for 2 to 3 minutes or till heated through. Assemble and bake sandwiches as above.

Meanwhile, in another skillet cook bratwursts, knackwurst, or frankfurters in a small amount of water about 5 minutes. Drain.

Add apple, mustard, and pepper. Place about ¼ cup stuffing atop each of five patties. Top with remaining patties. Press edges to seal. Place on a rack in a shallow baking dish or pan. Bake in a 375° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till no pink remains. Makes 5 servings.

Add liver to skillet. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Turn liver. Return onion to skillet. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes more or till liver is slightly pink in center. Pour lemon juice over. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Create-Your-Own Meat Loaf
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Customize your meat loaf with your choice of meat, bread, liquid, vegetable, and seasonings.

ingredients.item: soft bread crumbs (1 slice) or dry bread crumbs, or quick-cooking oats
tomato juice, beef broth, apple juice, or water
finely chopped onion, celery, carrot, or green pepper
dried thyme, basil, oregano, or sage, crushed (optional)

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, tomato juice or other liquid, onion or other vegetable, parsley, salt, herb (if desired), and pepper.

Add ground meat; mix well. Shape into a 2-inch-circle ring with a 2-inch diameter hole in the center, or form into a 7½x3-inch loaf, or pat mixture into a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan or divide into a 7½x3½-inch loaf pan.

Bake in a 350° oven for 45 to 50 minutes for the ring (25 to 30 minutes for the loaf or loaf pan) or till no pink remains. Transfer to a serving plate. Spoon sauce over meat, if desired; Makes 6 servings.

Microwave directions: In a mixing bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, milk, onion, celery, and parsley, if desired. Add ground meat and mix well. Shape into a 2-inch-circle ring with a 6-inch diameter hole in center. Place ring in a 9-inch pie plate. Cover with waxed paper. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 8 to 10 minutes or till no pink remains, giving the dish a quarter-turn every 3 minutes. Transfer to a serving plate.

notes: Ham Loaf: Prepare as above, except use soft bread crumbs. Substitute dry mustard for the herb and omit salt. Reduce ground beef or lamb to ½ pound and add ½ pound ground ham. Bake 50 minutes or till juices run clear.

recipes.title: Swedish Meatballs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg, cream or milk, the bread crumbs, onion, parsley, salt, and allspice or nutmeg. Add the beef and pork; mix well. Shape into 30 meatballs. In a large skillet cook meatballs, half at a time, over medium heat about 10 minutes or till no pink remains, turning to brown on all sides (shake skillet or turn meatballs once to prevent sticking).
Remove meatballs from skillet, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings. Drain meatballs on paper towels. Repeat with remaining meatballs.

Stir flour into reserved drippings. Add bouillon granules and 1¼ cups water. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Add meatballs to sauce. Cook on high for 4 to 6 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring twice.
Serve over noodles. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

notes: Microwave directions: In a mixing bowl combine egg, ¼ cup of the milk, the bread crumbs, onion, parsley, the ¼ teaspoon salt, and allspice or nutmeg. Add beef and pork; mix well. Shape into 30 meatballs. In a dish or plate microwave-safe, place meatballs on 100% power (high), covered with waxed paper, on 100% power (high) for 3½ to 5½ minutes or till no pink remains, rearranging once. Drain meatballs on paper towels. Repeat with remaining meatballs in 2-quart casserole. Cook and stir flour into remaining milk, bouillon granules and 1 cup water. Micro-cook, uncovered, on high for 6 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute. Add meatballs. Micro-cook, covered, on high for 1 minute more. Serve with noodles.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for light cream or milk (standard quantity)
Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped onion (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for soft bread crumbs
Assumed 1 unit for ground allspice or nutmeg

recipes.title: Spaghetti Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a Dutch oven cook meat, onion, and garlic till meat is brown. Drain. Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato paste, sugar, basil, oregano, tomato paste, 1 teaspoon salt, and bay leaf. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Discard bay leaf.
Serve sauce over spaghetti. If desired, pass grated Parmesan cheese. Makes 6 servings.

Microwave directions: Makes 6 servings. In a 3-quart casserole combine meat, onion, mushrooms, and garlic on 100% power (high) 6 to 8 minutes, stirring twice. Drain. Stir in remaining ingredients except spaghetti. Micro-cook, covered, on high for 15 minutes more or till slightly thickened, stirring occasionally. Discard bay leaf. Serve over spaghetti.

notes: Spaghetti and Meatballs: Prepare as above, except omit ground meat. Prepare Swedish Meatballs (see recipe, page 241), but do not serve on noodles. Cook ½ pound bulk Italian sausage, onion, mushrooms in a large skillet. Drain. Add meatballs to sauce. Heat through. Serve over spaghetti. Makes 6 servings.

recipes.title: Porcupine Meatballs

instructions.text: Combine egg, ¼ cup of the soup, uncooked rice, onion, salt, and Worcestershire. Add beef; mix well. Shape into 20 meatballs. Place in a large skillet.

Combine remaining soup with ½ cup water. Pour over meatballs. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer 35 to 40 minutes or till rice is tender. Stir in peas, if desired. Simmer 5 minutes more. Serves 4 or 5.

Microwave directions: Combine egg, ¼ cup of the soup, uncooked rice, onion, salt, and Worcestershire. Add beef; mix well. Shape into 20 meatballs. In an 8x8x2-inch baking dish micro-cook meatballs, covered, on 100% power (high) for 6 minutes, rearranging once. Drain. Pour over sauce. Micro-cook meatballs, covered, on high for 3 to 5 minutes more or till rice is tender.

recipes.title: Hamburgers
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: ground beef, veal, or ground lamb

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg and milk. Stir in bread crumbs, onion, mustard or horseradish, salt, and pepper. Add meat; mix well.

Form mixture into four ¾-inch-thick patties (10 to 12 minutes for 15 to 18 patties). Broil 3 to 4 inches from the heat for 10 to 12 minutes for 15 to 18 patties. Broil 3 to 4 inches from the heat of broiler. Turn once. Serve on buns. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Cheeseburgers: Prepare as above, except place sliced American, cheddar, Monterey Jack, or Swiss cheese on patties at end of cooking time. Broil about 1 minute or till cheese begins to melt.
Italian-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except substitute grated Parmesan cheese for the milk. Stir in 2 tablespoons snipped parsley and 1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning with the bread crumbs.

Mexican-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except substitute salsa or taco sauce for the milk and mustard. Stir in 2 tablespoons chopped canned green chili peppers and 1 teaspoon chili powder with the bread crumbs. Serve with additional salsa or taco sauce, if desired.

Greek-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except substitute plain yogurt for the milk and ¼ teaspoon cracked wheat or ¼ cup dried oregano, crushed, for the bread crumbs. Stir in ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon with the bread crumbs. If desired, serve with additional plain yogurt and 1 tablespoon curry powder with the bread crumbs.
Indian-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except substitute plain yogurt for milk and omit mustard. Stir in 2 tablespoons chopped chutney and 1 tablespoon curry powder with the bread crumbs.
German-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except stir in 2 tablespoons drained sauerkraut, chopped, and 1 teaspoon caraway seed with the bread crumbs. Serve with mustard.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheese-Stuffed Manicotti
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Cook manicotti according to package directions (or see chart, page 278); drain. For sauce, in a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in flour. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add Swiss cheese and wine; stir till cheese melts.

In a bowl stir together egg, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, parsley, peel, and nutmeg. Fill manicotti with ricotta mixture. Arrange in a 12x7½x2-inch baking dish. Pour sauce over filled shells. Cover and bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till hot. Serves 4.

Microwave directions: Cook manicotti as above. For sauce, in a 4-cup measure combine onion, garlic, and margarine. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 1½ to 2½ minutes or till onion is tender. Stir in flour. Add 1 cup milk. Stir. Cook on high for 3 to 5 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute till sauce starts to thicken, then every 30 seconds. Add Swiss cheese and wine; stir till cheese melts. Fill manicotti as above. Pour sauce atop. Cook, covered with vented clear plastic wrap, on high for 4 to 6 minutes or till heated through, turning dish once.

notes: Spinach Manicotti: Prepare as above, except reduce ricotta to ½ cup. Omit mozzarella and parsley. Add ½ cup crumbled feta cheese and one 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, to ricotta mixture.

Creamy Lasagna: Prepare as above, except substitute 8 lasagna noodles for the manicotti. Spread ¼ cup ricotta mixture over each cooked lasagna noodle. Roll up noodles and place, seam side down, in an 8x8x2-inch baking dish.

Top each of four patties with olives, vegetables, or cheese. Spread to within 1/2 inch of edges. Top with remaining patties. Press edges to seal.
