Bake in a 400°F oven for 15 to 20 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

notes: Microwave directions: Arrange fish in an 8x8x2-inch microwave-safe baking dish. Cook onion, garlic, and margarine on 100% power (high) for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in parsley, lemon peel, and orange juice. Spread over fish. Sprinkle with dillweed. Cover with vented plastic wrap. Cook on high for 7 to 9 minutes, giving dish a half-turn once.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 170)

recipes.title: Fish Potpies
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 170
recipes.description: Individual fish potpies with vegetables and Swiss cheese in marinara sauce, topped with pastry.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen haddock, cod, or orange roughy fillets

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. In saucepan combine marinara sauce, vegetables, carrot, cheese, parsley, and pimiento. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Cut fish into four pieces; stir into cheese mixture.
Spoon into four greased 8 or 10-ounce casseroles.
Cut pastry into 4 wedges. Place one pastry wedge on each casserole. Trim to fit. Cut slits into pastry.
Place on a baking sheet. Bake in a 400°F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 170)

recipes.title: Fish Stacks
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 170
recipes.description: Fish fillets topped with creamy vegetable mixture and crescent roll dough.

instructions.text: Thaw fish fillets. Cut into 4x3-inch portions. Place in a shallow baking dish.
Cook onion, carrot, and mushrooms in margarine, covered, about 5 minutes. Uncover; simmer 2 to 4 minutes more or till excess liquid evaporates.
Remove from heat. Stir in cream cheese, dillweed, and pepper. Spoon vegetable mixture over each fish portion.
Separate crescent rolls into 2 rectangles. Pinch perforations to seal. Cut each rectangle in half.
Place one rectangle atop each fish portion. Brush dough with milk, if desired.
Bake in a 350°F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till fish is done and dough is golden.

notes: The cream cheese and vegetable topping keeps the fish moist

recipes.title: Broccoli-Stuffed Sole
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 171
recipes.description: Delicate sole fillets rolled around a broccoli and Parmesan cheese filling.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen skinless sole fillets
soft-style cream cheese with chives and onion

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen.
For filling, combine broccoli, Parmesan cheese, cream cheese, and pine nuts.
Place about 1/4 cup filling on one end of each fillet. Roll up fillets.
Secure rolls with wooden picks. Place in a baking dish. Drizzle with wine.
Bake in a 350°F oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

notes: Microwave directions: Assemble fish rolls, omitting wine. Place in a microwave-safe dish. Cover with vented plastic wrap. Microwave on 100% power (high) for 3 to 5 minutes or till fish flakes easily, giving dish a half-turn once.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 171)

recipes.title: Baked Fish with Mushrooms
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 171
recipes.description: Quick baked fish fillets topped with sauteed mushrooms and green onions.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets or steaks

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Arrange fish in a 12x7-1/2x2-inch baking dish, turning under thin edges. Sprinkle with salt.
Cook mushrooms, onion, and tarragon in margarine till tender. Spoon over fish.
Sprinkle with paprika. Bake, covered, in a 450°F oven for 6 to 10 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

notes: Marked as FAST in cookbook

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 171)

recipes.title: Wild-Rice-Stuffed Fish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 171
recipes.description: Whole dressed fish stuffed with a wild rice, mushroom, and vegetable mixture.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen dressed whitefish or other fish

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Rinse rice thoroughly.
Cook mushrooms, celery, onion, and garlic in margarine till tender.
Stir in broth and wild rice. Cover and simmer 45 to 50 minutes till rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Stir in pimiento, sherry, parsley, and lemon peel.
Spoon stuffing into fish cavities, pressing lightly with back of spoon so fish lies flat.
Place stuffed fish in a large baking dish. Cover loosely with foil.
Bake in a 350°F oven for 30 to 40 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Use two large spatulas to transfer fish to serving platter.

notes: Tip: Spoon stuffing into fish, then press lightly with the back of the spoon so the fish lies flat
Use two large spatulas for transferring the stuffed fish

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 171)

recipes.title: Fish en Papillote
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 172
recipes.description: Elegant French technique of baking fish in parchment paper packets with a creamy vegetable sauce.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen skinless flounder, perch, sole, or pompano fillets

ingredients.prep_note: cut into heart shapes, 12 inches wide and 9 inches long

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut 4 pieces of parchment paper into heart shapes, 12 inches wide and 9 inches long.
In a large skillet bring water, lemon slices, bay leaf, and bouillon granules to boiling. Add fish.
Simmer, covered, for 4 to 6 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Using a slotted spoon, remove fish. Reserve 1/2 cup cooking liquid.
In same skillet cook carrots and onion in margarine till tender. Stir in flour and mustard.
Add reserved liquid and milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more.
To assemble, place one fillet on one half of each parchment heart. Top with one fourth of the sauce.
Fold the other half of the heart over fillet. Starting at the top, seal tightly by turning up edges and folding in twice. At bottom, twist the tip of heart to seal.
Place packets on a large baking sheet. Bake in a 400°F oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till slightly puffed.
Transfer to dinner plates. To serve, cut an X in top of each packet. Pull back the paper.

notes: En papillote (pah-pee-YOHT) is French for 'in paper' - a simple yet elegant way to cook fish
The packets puff up as steam forms inside, creating a dramatic presentation

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 172)

recipes.title: Chilled Salmon Steaks with Tarragon Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 173
recipes.description: Poached salmon steaks served chilled with a tangy tarragon dressing.

instructions.text: Thaw salmon, if frozen.
In large skillet bring water or Court Bouillon to boiling. Add salmon steaks. Return to boiling; reduce heat.
Simmer, covered, 8 to 12 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.
Remove fish; cool. Remove skin. Cover and chill up to 24 hours.
For dressing, in a jar combine onion, broth, oil, tarragon, parsley, mustard, sugar, and pepper. Shake well.
Pour dressing over chilled salmon and serve.

notes: Perfect for warm weather entertaining
Can be chilled up to 24 hours ahead

recipes.title: Poached Fish with Dill Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 173
recipes.description: Whole poached fish served with a creamy dill sauce.

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen.
In a fish poacher or large roasting pan with a wire rack with handles, add enough water to almost reach the rack. Add bay leaf, tarragon, and lemon slices.
Place fish on rack. Lower into pan. Simmer, covered, 35 to 40 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.
Remove fish; keep warm. Reserve 1/4 cup cooking liquid.
For sauce, in a saucepan melt margarine. Stir in flour and dillweed. Add reserved liquid and milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook 1 minute more.
Serve sauce over fish.

recipes.pan_size: fish poacher or large roasting pan
notes: Use a fish poacher with rack for easy removal of whole fish

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 173)

recipes.title: Vegetable-Topped Fillets
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 173
recipes.description: Colorful fish fillets topped with sauteed summer squash, zucchini, and tomatoes.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen skinless sole or other white fish fillets

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish.
Place fish in a greased baking dish. Bake in a 450°F oven till fish flakes easily (4 to 6 minutes per 1/2-inch thickness).
Meanwhile, in a skillet cook zucchini, summer squash, and garlic in margarine till nearly tender.
Add tomatoes and basil. Cook and stir 2 minutes more.
Spoon vegetable mixture over baked fish.

notes: A colorful, healthy topping for mild white fish
Microwave directions: Cook vegetables in margarine in a microwave-safe dish on high for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring once. Add tomatoes and basil; cook 1 minute more.

recipes.title: Trout Amandine
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 174
recipes.description: Classic French preparation of pan-fried trout topped with buttery toasted almonds.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen pan-dressed trout or other fish

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Bone fish, if desired.
Combine flour and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Stir together egg and milk.
Dip fish in flour mixture to coat, then in egg mixture.
In a 12-inch skillet heat oil. Fry fish in hot oil for 5 to 6 minutes on each side or till golden and fish flakes easily with a fork.
Remove fish and keep warm.
In a medium saucepan melt margarine. Cook sliced almonds till golden.
Place fish on a serving platter. Spoon almond mixture over fish. Garnish with lemon slices.

notes: Marked as FAST in cookbook
The perfect recipe for freshly caught fish - 'It's in your pan, but your catch of the day!'

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 174)

recipes.title: Pan-Fried Fish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 174
recipes.description: Classic cornmeal-crusted pan-fried fish fillets with crispy coating.

ingredients.item: cornmeal or fine dry bread crumbs

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. Cut into serving-size portions. Pat dry.
In a shallow dish combine egg and 2 tablespoons water.
In another dish, mix cornmeal or bread crumbs, salt, and pepper.
Dip fish into egg mixture, then coat with cornmeal mixture.
Fry the fish in hot oil on one side till golden. Turn and cook on the other side (3 to 4 minutes per side for 1/4-inch-thick fillets, longer for thicker fish).

notes: The crispy coating seals in the fresh fish flavor
Oven-Chip Pan-Fried Fish: Substitute 1/4 cup crushed potato chips or salted crackers for the cornmeal
Curried Pan-Fried Fish: Add 1 tablespoon lemon or lime juice to egg mixture, add 2 teaspoons curry powder to cornmeal mixture. Serve with chutney.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 174)

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Stir-Fried Fish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175
recipes.description: Quick stir-fried fish with pineapple and sweet peppers in a tangy sauce, served over rice.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen monkfish, sea bass, or pike

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut into 1-inch pieces.
For sauce, combine reserved pineapple juice, brown sugar, cornstarch, rice vinegar, and soy sauce.
Heat wok or large skillet over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon oil. Stir-fry green onion and sweet pepper 2 to 3 minutes or till crisp-tender. Remove.
Add remaining oil. Stir-fry fish for 5 minutes or till fish flakes easily. Remove.
Stir sauce; add to wok. Cook and stir till bubbly.
Stir in pineapple, fish, and vegetables. Cook and stir till heated through. Serve over rice.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 175)

recipes.title: Fish and Chips
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175
recipes.description: Classic British pub-style deep-fried fish in beer batter served with homemade chips.

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen.
For chips, cut potatoes into lengthwise 3/8-inch-wide sticks. Pat dry.
In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat shortening or oil to 375°F.
Fry potatoes, about one-third at a time, for 4 to 6 minutes or till light brown. Remove and drain on paper towels. Keep warm in a 300°F oven.
Cut fish into serving-size pieces. For batter, combine flour and salt. Add beer or milk; beat till smooth.
Dip fish into batter. Fry fish in hot fat, 2 or 3 pieces at a time, about 2 minutes on each side or till golden brown.
Drain and keep warm in oven while frying remaining fish. Serve with malt or cider vinegar.

recipes.temperature: 375°F (190°C) for frying, 300°F oven to keep warm
notes: Beer gives a lighter, crispier batter; milk works well too
Classic British pub fare

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 175)

recipes.title: Hot Tuna Cups
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175
recipes.description: Creamy tuna filling baked in biscuit cups topped with cheese and tomato.

instructions.text: Separate biscuits. Grease the outside of six 6-ounce custard cups.
Press one biscuit over bottom and halfway down sides of each custard cup.
Place cups, dough side up, on a 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake in a 400°F oven 7 minutes or till lightly browned. Remove biscuits from cups immediately.
Meanwhile, cook celery and onion in margarine till tender. Stir in mustard, tuna, peas, and half of the cheese.
Spoon tuna mixture into biscuit cups. Top with tomato slices and remaining cheese.
Return to oven and bake 7 minutes or till cheese melts.

notes: A creative way to serve tuna salad in edible biscuit cups

recipes.title: Creamed Tuna
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175
recipes.description: Creamy tuna in white sauce served over toasted English muffins or noodles.

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook green onion in margarine till tender.
Stir in flour and dash pepper. Add wine and milk all at once.
Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more.
Stir in tuna; heat through.
Serve over toasted English muffin halves. Sprinkle with almonds, if desired.

notes: Try this over toasted biscuits or cooked noodles
A comforting classic - perfect for a quick weeknight dinner

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 175)

recipes.title: Tuna-Noodle Casserole
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 176
recipes.description: Home-style cooking at its best - classic creamy tuna casserole with noodles.

ingredients.item: condensed cream of mushroom or celery soup

ingredients.prep_note: drained and flaked (or two 6.5 oz cans)

instructions.text: Cook noodles or macaroni according to package directions; drain.
In a saucepan cook celery and onion in margarine till tender.
Stir in soup, milk, pimiento, and tuna. Add cooked noodles; mix well.
Transfer to a 1-1/2 quart casserole. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake, covered, in a 375°F oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till heated through.

notes: Marked as EASY in cookbook - Home-style cooking at its best
Vegetable variation: Stir in 2 cups cooked vegetables with the noodles
Extra-Creamy variation: Substitute one 8-oz container sour cream or yogurt for the condensed soup

Microwave directions: Cook noodles according to package. In 2-quart casserole, microwave celery and onion in margarine, covered, on high 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in soup, milk, pimiento, tuna, and noodles. Microwave uncovered on high 3-1/2 to 5-1/2 minutes till hot and bubbly.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 176)

recipes.title: Tuna-Broccoli Crepes
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 176
recipes.description: Elegant crepes filled with tuna and broccoli in a creamy cheese sauce - special enough for company.

ingredients.prep_note: drained and broken into chunks (or 7.5 oz salmon, skin and bones removed)

instructions.text: Cook broccoli according to package directions. Drain. Cut up any large pieces. Set aside.
For cheese sauce, in a medium saucepan cook onion in margarine till tender but not brown.
Stir in flour, salt, and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Add cheese. Cook and stir till cheese melts. Remove from heat.
Combine broccoli, tuna, and 3/4 cup of the cheese sauce.
Spoon about 3 tablespoons of the tuna mixture onto each crepe. Roll up.
Place crepes seam side down in a 12x7-1/2x2-inch baking dish.
Bake, covered, in a 375°F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till heated through.
Reheat remaining cheese sauce, adding milk if needed. Spoon over crepes. Sprinkle with paprika and almonds.

notes: Special enough for company
Can substitute salmon for tuna

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 176)

recipes.title: Tuna-Biscuit Casseroles
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 177
recipes.description: Individual casseroles with creamy tuna and vegetables topped with biscuits.

instructions.text: Cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender.
Stir in flour, thyme, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add broth and milk.
Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Stir in tuna, vegetables, and parsley.
Divide mixture among four to six 10- to 12-ounce casseroles. Top each with a biscuit.
Bake in a 400°F oven 10 to 12 minutes or till biscuits are lightly browned.

recipes.pan_size: four to six 10-12 oz individual casseroles
notes: Marked as EASY in cookbook
Biscuits are the topping for these individual casseroles

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 177)

recipes.title: Salmon Loaf
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 177
recipes.description: Classic salmon loaf with dill, optionally topped with cheese sauce.

ingredients.prep_note: bones removed (or two 6.5 oz cans tuna, drained)

ingredients.item: Cheese Sauce or American cheese slices

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion, dillweed, and a dash pepper in margarine till onion is tender.
Combine egg, bread crumbs, milk, and onion mixture.
Add salmon; mix well.
Shape into a 6x3-inch loaf in a greased shallow baking pan.
Bake in a 350°F oven for 30 to 35 minutes.
Top with Cheese Sauce (see page 361) or cheese slices, if desired.

notes: No time for the sauce? Cook a 10-ounce package frozen creamed peas and onions to ladle over the loaf

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 177)

recipes.title: Salmon-Pasta Skillet
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 177
recipes.description: One-skillet meal with salmon, pasta shells, and vegetables in a creamy mustard sauce.

ingredients.prep_note: drained, flaked, skin and bones removed

instructions.text: In large skillet bring chicken broth to boiling.
Add vegetables and pasta. Return to boiling; reduce heat.
Simmer, covered, for 15 to 20 minutes or till pasta is tender.
Stir in cheese and mustard.
Gently fold in salmon. Cook till heated through.

notes: Marked as EASY in cookbook
A complete one-skillet meal

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 177)

recipes.title: Pasta Primavera
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 268
recipes.description: A colorful vegetable pasta dish with a light cream sauce.

instructions.text: Cook pasta (see chart, page 278). Drain well.

Meanwhile, in a large skillet melt 2 tablespoons of the margarine. Cook and stir broccoli, onion, and garlic in butter over medium-high heat for 3 minutes. Stir in wine. Cook and stir over medium-high heat about 2 minutes more or till broccoli is crisp-tender.
Stir in pea pods and thyme. Cook and stir 1 minute. Transfer to a serving plate. Sprinkle with cheese.

notes: Ham Pasta Primavera: Prepare as above, except stir 1 cup fully cooked cubed ham or turkey ham into vegetable mixture with the pea pods. Sprinkle with more Parmesan if desired. Makes 8 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 268)

recipes.title: Fettuccine with Marinara Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 268
recipes.description: Classic fettuccine with a rich tomato marinara sauce.

instructions.text: For marinara sauce, in a medium saucepan cook onion and garlic in oil till tender but not brown. Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, sugar, and salt.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, about 30 minutes or till desired consistency.
Meanwhile, cook pasta (see chart, page 278). Drain well. Serve with marinara sauce. Serves 8.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 268)

recipes.title: Pasta with Carbonara Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 268
recipes.description: Bits of bacon highlight the cheesy, creamy sauce.

instructions.text: Let egg, cream, and margarine or butter stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Cook bacon on paper towels till crisp. Drain well. Return pasta to saucepan and place over low heat.

Meanwhile, cook pasta (see chart, page 278). Drain well. Return pasta to saucepan and place over low heat. Toss margarine with pasta. Beat together egg and cream; pour over hot pasta. Toss gently till pasta is well coated. Add bacon, cheese, and parsley; toss to mix. Season with coarsely ground pepper. Transfer to a warm serving dish. Serves 3 or 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 268)

recipes.title: Fettuccine Alfredo
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 270
recipes.description: Classic creamy Alfredo sauce tossed with fettuccine.

instructions.text: Let cream come to room temperature. Drain pasta well. Return to hot saucepan. Add cream, margarine or butter. Toss gently till pasta is well coated.
Add Parmesan cheese; toss to combine. Transfer to a warm serving dish. Sprinkle with pepper and nutmeg. Serve immediately. Makes 8 servings.

notes: Fettuccine Alfredo with Mushrooms: Prepare as above, except cook 1 1/2 cups sliced fresh mushrooms and 1 clove garlic, minced, in the margarine or butter till tender. Add to drained pasta with cream and Parmesan cheese.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 270)

recipes.title: Potluck Pasta
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 270
recipes.description: Transform this side dish into a main dish just by adding tuna, ham, or chicken or turkey.

ingredients.item: large macaroni shells, rotini, or elbow macaroni
cream of chicken or cream of mushroom soup

instructions.text: In a large saucepan cook pasta (see chart, page 278); adding frozen vegetable and onion the last 6 minutes. Drain in a colander.

In the same saucepan stir together condensed soup, sour cream, cheddar cheese, milk, carrot, oregano or basil, and pepper. Cook and stir over medium heat till bubbly and cheddar cheese is melted. Add pasta mixture; toss to coat. Transfer to a 2-quart casserole.
Bake, covered, in a 350° oven about 55 minutes or till heated through.

To make ahead: Prepare as above, except transfer mixture to a 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Cover and chill for 3 to 24 hours. To serve, bake, covered, in a 350° oven about 55 minutes or till heated through.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 270)

recipes.title: Fried Rice
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 273
recipes.description: Asian-style fried rice with ham and vegetables.

instructions.text: In a large skillet heat 2 tablespoons of the oil over medium heat. Add eggs and cook without stirring till set. Loosen eggs and invert skillet over cutting board; cut into short, narrow strips.
In the skillet heat the remaining oil over medium heat. Cook ham, mushrooms, onion, and ginger in the hot oil for 3 minutes.
Stir in cooked rice, cabbage, and egg strips; sprinkle with soy sauce. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes or till heated through, tossing gently to coat with soy sauce.

notes: Vegetable Fried Rice: Omit ham and stir in 1/4 cup frozen peas, thawed, into the skillet with the rice.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 273)

recipes.title: Four-Way Chicken
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 299
recipes.description: Basic roasted chicken with four different sauce options.

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Skewer neck skin to back. Tie legs to tail; twist wing tips under back. Place, breast side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Brush with oil; sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Roast, uncovered, in a 375° oven for 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 hours or till drumstick moves easily in socket. When bird is two-thirds done, cut string between legs. Brush with desired sauce during the last 15 minutes of roasting. Makes 6 servings.

notes: Barbecue Sauce: Combine 1/2 cup catsup, 2 tablespoons brown sugar, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce.

Cumberland Sauce: In a saucepan combine 1/2 cup currant jelly, 2 tablespoons orange juice, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger, and dash ground red pepper. Cook and stir till jelly melts.
Ginger-Honey Glaze: Combine 2 tablespoons honey, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, and 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger.

recipes.title: Pepper-Lime Chicken
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 300
recipes.description: Grilled chicken with a zesty pepper-lime marinade.

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Place in a plastic bag set in a shallow dish. For marinade, combine lime juice, oil, pepper, paprika, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Pour over chicken. Close bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 24 hours, turning bag occasionally.

Drain chicken, reserving marinade. Place chicken, bone side up, on an uncovered grill directly over medium coals. Grill for 20 minutes. Turn chicken; brush with reserved marinade. Grill for 15 to 25 minutes more or till tender, brushing often with marinade. Makes 6 servings.

notes: Lemon-Mustard Chicken: Prepare as above, except substitute 3 tablespoons lemon juice for lime juice and 1 tablespoon Dijon-style mustard for the pepper.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 300)

recipes.title: Herb-Marinated Chicken
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 300
recipes.description: Grilled chicken with herb vinaigrette marinade.

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Place in a plastic bag set in a shallow dish. For marinade, combine vinegar, oil, garlic, basil, thyme, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Pour over chicken; close bag.
Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 24 hours, turning bag occasionally. Grill as for Pepper-Lime Chicken. Makes 6 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 300)

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Glazed Chicken
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 301
recipes.description: Grilled chicken with a tangy sweet-and-sour glaze.

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. For glaze, combine undrained pineapple, brown sugar, lemon juice, and soy sauce.

Place chicken, bone side up, on an uncovered grill directly over medium coals. Grill for 20 minutes. Turn; grill 15 to 25 minutes more or till tender, brushing with glaze the last 10 minutes. Heat any remaining glaze; pass with chicken.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 301)

recipes.title: Chicken Kabobs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 301
recipes.description: Grilled chicken and vegetable kabobs with honey-lime glaze.

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Cut into 1-inch pieces. For glaze, combine honey, lime juice, and mustard.

On six long skewers, alternately thread chicken, zucchini, and tomatoes. Place on an uncovered grill directly over medium coals. Grill for 12 to 14 minutes or till chicken is tender and no longer pink, turning and brushing often with glaze. Makes 6 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 301)

recipes.title: Cranberry-Sauced Turkey Steaks
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 302
recipes.description: Broiled turkey steaks with tangy cranberry sauce.

ingredients.item: cranberry-orange relish or whole cranberry sauce

instructions.text: Rinse turkey; pat dry. Place on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 4 to 5 inches from the heat for 5 minutes.

Meanwhile, for sauce, combine relish or cranberry sauce, orange juice, mustard, and ginger. Turn turkey; brush with sauce. Broil for 5 to 7 minutes more or till no longer pink, brushing once more with sauce. Heat remaining sauce; serve with turkey. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 302)

recipes.title: Oven-Fried Chicken
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 303
recipes.description: Crispy oven-baked chicken with a variety of coating options.

instructions.text: Skin chicken, if desired. Rinse; pat dry. Brush chicken with melted margarine or butter.
In a plastic bag combine bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, thyme or sage, paprika, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add 2 or 3 pieces of chicken at a time; shake to coat.

In a greased 15x10x1-inch baking pan arrange chicken, bone side down, so pieces don't touch. Drizzle with remaining margarine. Bake, uncovered, in a 375° oven for 45 to 55 minutes or till tender and no longer pink. Do not turn. Makes 6 servings.

notes: Potato-Chip Chicken: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 1/4 cups finely crushed potato chips for the bread crumbs. Omit thyme and paprika.
Parmesan Chicken: Prepare as above, except increase Parmesan cheese to 1/2 cup and omit thyme.
Curry-and-Parsley Chicken: Prepare as above, except add 1/2 to 3/4 teaspoon curry powder to crumb mixture.

Crispy Barbecue-Style Chicken: Prepare as above, except substitute 1/2 cup bottled barbecue sauce for the melted margarine or butter. Reduce crumbs to 1/2 cup; omit Parmesan cheese, herb, and paprika.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 303)

recipes.title: Chicken Nuggets
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 303
recipes.description: Crispy bite-size chicken pieces.

ingredients.item: dried basil, oregano, or thyme, crushed

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Cut into 1-inch pieces.
In a plastic bag combine crumbs, Parmesan cheese, herb, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Dip chicken pieces in margarine; shake, a few at a time, in crumb mixture.
Arrange in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Bake in a 400° oven for 6 to 8 minutes or till no longer pink.

notes: Chili Chicken Nuggets: Prepare as above, except add 1 1/2 teaspoons chili powder to crumb mixture.
Sesame-Soy Chicken Nuggets: Prepare as above, except substitute 2 tablespoons sesame seed for the Parmesan cheese and 1/4 cup soy sauce for the margarine or butter.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 303)

recipes.title: Chicken Dijon
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 304
recipes.description: Creamy Dijon mustard sauce over tender chicken breasts.

ingredients.item: long grain rice or herb-flavored rice mix

instructions.text: Cook rice according to package directions. Meanwhile, rinse chicken; pat dry. Sprinkle both sides of chicken with lemon-pepper seasoning and onion powder.
In a skillet cook chicken in margarine over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes or till tender and no longer pink, turning to brown evenly. Transfer to a platter; keep warm.

For sauce, measure pan juices; add light cream or milk to make 1/2 cup liquid. Return to the skillet. Stir 1/4 cup light cream or milk into flour; add to juices mixture. Stir in mustard. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes more. Spoon some sauce over chicken; pass remaining sauce. Serve with rice. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 304)

recipes.title: Chicken Kiev
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 304
recipes.description: Classic stuffed chicken breasts with herb butter.

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Place each breast half, boned side up, between 2 pieces of clear plastic wrap. Working from the center to the edges, pound lightly with the flat side of a meat mallet to 1/4-inch thickness. Remove plastic wrap. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Combine onion, parsley, and garlic; sprinkle on chicken.

Cut chilled butter into four 2 1/2x1/2-inch sticks. Place one piece in the center of each chicken piece. Fold in sides; roll up jelly-roll style, pressing edges to seal. Stir together egg and 1 tablespoon water. Coat rolls with flour, dip into egg mixture, then coat with crumbs. Cover; chill 1 to 24 hours.

In a large skillet melt the 1 tablespoon butter; add oil. Add chilled chicken rolls; cook over medium-high heat about 5 minutes or till golden brown, turning to brown all sides. Transfer to a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Bake in a 400° oven for 15 to 18 minutes or till no longer pink. Spoon drippings over rolls. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Cheesy Chicken Kiev: Prepare as above, except, for the butter in chicken rolls, substitute four 2x1/2-inch sticks of caraway cheese, Gruyère cheese, blue cheese, Camembert (rind removed), Brie (rind removed), or cheddar cheese.

Pick-a-Butter Chicken Kiev: Prepare as above, except, for the butter in the chicken rolls, substitute 1/4 cup (1/2 recipe) parsley butter or lemon-tarragon butter (see tip, page 368), shaped into four 2 1/2x1/2-inch sticks and chilled.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 304)

recipes.title: Chicken Saltimbocca
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 305
recipes.description: Italian-style chicken rolls with prosciutto and cheese.

ingredients.prep_note: (1 1/2 pounds total), skinned, boned, and halved lengthwise

ingredients.item: thin slices prosciutto or fully cooked ham
dairy sour cream or plain yogurt

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Place each breast half, boned side up, between 2 pieces of clear plastic wrap. Working from the center to the edges, pound lightly with the flat side of a mallet to form 1/8-inch-thick rectangles. Remove plastic wrap.

For each roll, place 1 slice of prosciutto or ham on a chicken piece, folding if necessary to fit. Place 1 slice of cheese atop prosciutto or ham near one edge. Top with some of the tomato. Fold in long sides of chicken and roll up jelly-roll style, starting from the edge with the cheese. Secure with wooden toothpicks.
In a large skillet cook chicken rolls in 2 tablespoons of the margarine over medium-low heat for 25 to 30 minutes or till no longer pink, turning to brown evenly. Remove toothpicks.

For sauce, in a medium saucepan melt remaining margarine. Add mushrooms and garlic. Cook till tender. Remove from heat. Stir together milk, sour cream, flour, paprika, nutmeg, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add to sauce. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Arrange noodles and chicken on a platter. Pour sauce over all. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 305)

recipes.title: Chicken Marsala
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 306
recipes.description: Tender chicken in a rich Marsala wine sauce with mushrooms.

ingredients.prep_note: (1 1/2 pounds total), skinned, boned, and halved lengthwise

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Place each breast half, boned side up, between 2 pieces of clear plastic wrap. Working from the center to edges, pound lightly with the flat side of a mallet till 1/8 inch thick. Remove the plastic wrap. Stir together flour, marjoram, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Lightly press chicken pieces into flour mixture on both sides; shake off excess.

In a large skillet cook mushrooms and green onion in 1 tablespoon of the margarine till tender; remove from skillet. In the same skillet cook chicken pieces in remaining margarine over medium-high heat for 4 minutes, turning to brown evenly. Remove skillet from heat. Return mushrooms and onion to skillet. Carefully add broth and marsala. Cook, uncovered, 2 to 3 minutes or till mushroom mixture thickens slightly, stirring occasionally. Transfer chicken to a serving platter. Spoon mushroom mixture over. Sprinkle with snipped parsley, if desired. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 306)

recipes.title: Skillet-Fried Chicken
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 307
recipes.description: Classic pan-fried chicken with crispy coating.

ingredients.item: all-purpose flour or 1/2 cup fine dry bread crumbs
paprika, curry powder, chili powder, or dried basil or marjoram, crushed; or 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder or onion powder

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. In a plastic bag combine flour, paprika or other seasoning, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add chicken pieces, a few at a time, shaking to coat.

In a 12-inch skillet heat oil. Add chicken, placing meaty pieces toward the center of the skillet. Cook, uncovered, over medium heat for 15 minutes, turning to brown evenly. Reduce heat; cover tightly. Cook for 25 minutes. Uncover; cook for 5 to 10 minutes more or till tender and no longer pink. Drain on paper towels. Makes 6 servings.

Oven directions: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Coat chicken as above. Brown chicken in a 12-inch ovenproof skillet. (Or, brown chicken in a regular skillet, then transfer, skin side up, to a 15x10x1-inch baking pan.) Place in a 375° oven. Bake, uncovered, for 35 to 40 minutes or till no longer pink. Do not turn.
Crisp-Fried Chicken: Prepare as above, except, after browning for 15 minutes, cook, uncovered, over medium-low heat for 35 to 40 minutes more or till no longer pink, turning often.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 307)

recipes.title: Garlic Chicken
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 308
recipes.description: Stir-fried chicken with lots of garlic.

ingredients.item: dry sherry or dry white wine

ingredients.prep_note: (1 pound total), skinned, boned, and cut into 3/4-inch pieces
minced (3 tablespoons), or 2 to 3 tablespoons bottled minced garlic

instructions.text: For marinade, in a bowl stir together water, sherry, and soy sauce. Add chicken to marinade. Cut chicken into 3/4-inch pieces. Rinse chicken; dry. Cut chicken into 3/4-inch pieces. Add chicken to marinade, stirring to coat. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Drain chicken.

Preheat a wok or large skillet over high heat; add oil. (Add more oil as necessary during cooking.) Stir-fry green onions or leeks, garlic, and water chestnuts for 1 to 2 minutes or till crisp-tender. Remove from wok or skillet.

Add half of the chicken to hot wok or skillet. Stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes or till no longer pink. Remove. Stir-fry remaining chicken for 2 to 3 minutes. Return all chicken and garlic mixture to wok. Stir in reserved marinade. Heat through. Serve over rice sticks. Serves 4.

notes: Garlic Chicken with Zucchini: Prepare as above, except stir-fry 1 1/2 cups (about 1 1/4 cups) halved lengthwise and cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices zucchini for 3 minutes. Remove from wok or skillet. Return zucchini to wok with cooked chicken.

Chicken with Cashews: Prepare as above, except stir 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper into marinade. Reduce garlic to 2 cloves (or 1 1/2 teaspoons bottled minced garlic). Stir-fry 1 cup unsalted cashews or peanuts with the garlic and green onions.

Orange Chicken with Walnuts: Prepare as above, except substitute finely shredded orange peel for the sherry and add 1/2 teaspoon finely shredded orange peel to the sauce. Stir in two oranges, peeled and sectioned, just before serving.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 308)

recipes.title: Chicken with Walnuts
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 308
recipes.description: Stir-fried chicken with walnuts and vegetables.

instructions.text: For sauce, in a small bowl stir together soy sauce, sherry, sugar, and cornstarch, and red pepper. Set aside. Rinse chicken; pat dry. Cut into 1-inch pieces, set aside.
Preheat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add walnuts; stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes or till lightly toasted. Remove from wok or skillet; set aside.
Add oil to wok. Stir-fry green peppers and ginger for 1 to 2 minutes or till crisp-tender. Remove from wok.
Add half of the chicken to the wok or skillet. Stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes or till no longer pink. Remove. Stir-fry remaining chicken 2 to 3 minutes; remove.

Stir sauce; add to the center of the wok or skillet. Cook and stir till bubbly. Return all chicken, green peppers, and walnuts to wok. Stir all ingredients to coat with sauce. Stir-fry about 1 minute or till heated through. Stir in kumquats, if desired. Serve with hot rice. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 308)

recipes.title: Ginger Chicken
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 309
recipes.description: Stir-fried chicken with ginger and vegetables.

ingredients.item: fresh pea pods, tips and strings removed, or one 6-ounce package frozen pea pods, thawed
bias-sliced bok choy or chopped cabbage

instructions.text: Stir together sherry, soy sauce, hoisin or bean sauce, water, and cornstarch. Set aside. Rinse chicken; pat dry. Cut into thin bite-size strips.

Preheat a wok or large skillet over high heat; add 1 tablespoon of the oil. (Add remaining oil as necessary during cooking.) Add bok choy or cabbage, carrots, and stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes or till crisp. Add pea pods, bok choy, carrots, and onions; stir-fry about 3 seconds. Add soy sauce mixture to wok or skillet. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir about 1 minute more. Serve with hot rice. Makes 4 servings.
Stir the soy sauce mixture to remix the ingredients, then add it to the center of the wok or skillet.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 309)

recipes.title: Chicken Fricassee
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 312
recipes.description: This braised chicken, with its rich, creamy sauce, represents country cooking at its best.

ingredients.item: chopped green or sweet red pepper or celery
dried basil, marjoram, oregano, or thyme, crushed

instructions.text: In a plastic or paper bag combine the 1/4 cup flour, paprika, salt, and pepper. Skin chicken, if desired. Rinse chicken; pat dry. Add chicken, two or three pieces at a time, to the bag, shaking to coat well.
In a 12-inch skillet cook chicken in hot oil about 15 minutes or till lightly browned, turning to brown evenly. Remove chicken; set aside.

Drain fat, reserving 2 tablespoons of the drippings in the skillet (add more oil, if necessary). Add mushrooms, green or red pepper or celery, and green onion to skillet. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Stir in chicken broth and basil, marjoram, oregano, or thyme.

Bring to boiling, scraping up browned bits from the bottom of the skillet. Return chicken to the skillet. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 35 to 40 minutes or till chicken is tender and no longer pink.

Transfer chicken and vegetables to a platter; keep warm. Skim fat from pan juices; measure 3/4 cup of the pan juices and return to the skillet. Stir cream or milk into the 1 tablespoon flour. Stir into pan juices. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minute more.
Spoon some of the sauce over chicken; pass remaining sauce. Serve with hot noodles or spaetzle. Makes 6 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 312)

recipes.title: Chicken Paprikash
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 312
recipes.description: Hungarian-style chicken in a rich paprika sour cream sauce.

instructions.text: Skin chicken, if desired. Rinse and pat dry. In a 12-inch skillet cook chicken in hot oil about 15 minutes or till lightly browned, turning to brown evenly. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Remove chicken; set aside.

Add onion and paprika to skillet; cook till onion is tender. Add chicken, turning pieces to coat with paprika mixture. Add broth and wine. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer 40 minutes or till chicken is tender and no longer pink.
Transfer chicken to a platter. Cover and keep warm.

For sauce, skim fat from pan juices. Measure 1 1/2 cups juices, adding water, if necessary. In a bowl stir together sour cream and flour; gradually stir in juices mixture. Pour into skillet. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly; cook and stir for 1 minute more. Spoon some sauce over chicken; pass remainder. Serve with hot cooked noodles or rice. Makes 6 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 312)

recipes.title: Chicken Cacciatore
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 313
recipes.description: Italian hunter-style chicken braised with tomatoes and mushrooms.

instructions.text: Skin chicken, if desired. Rinse and pat dry. In a large skillet cook chicken, onion, and garlic in hot oil about 15 minutes or till chicken is lightly browned, turning to brown evenly. Drain off fat.

Stir together mushrooms, tomato sauce, undrained tomatoes, wine, broth, basil, bay leaf, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Pour over chicken in the skillet. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 30 to 35 minutes or till chicken is tender and no longer pink.

Transfer chicken to a platter. Cover; keep warm. Discard bay leaf. Skim fat from tomato mixture. Stir together cornstarch and 2 tablespoons cold water; stir into tomato mixture. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Serve over chicken and noodles. Makes 6 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 313)

recipes.title: Coq au Vin
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 313
recipes.description: Classic French chicken braised in burgundy wine sauce.

instructions.text: Skin chicken, if desired. Rinse and pat dry. In a 12-inch skillet cook chicken pieces in hot oil about 15 minutes or till lightly browned, turning to brown evenly. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add onions or shallots, burgundy, mushrooms, carrot, the 1 tablespoon parsley, garlic, marjoram, thyme, and bay leaf. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 35 to 40 minutes or till chicken is tender and no longer pink.
Transfer chicken and vegetables to a serving platter. Cover and keep warm. Discard bay leaf.

In a bowl stir together flour and softened margarine or butter to make a smooth paste. Stir into burgundy mixture in the skillet. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Pour burgundy mixture over chicken and vegetables. Sprinkle with bacon and, if desired, additional parsley. Serve with hot noodles. Makes 6 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 313)

recipes.title: Chicken Enchiladas
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 317
recipes.description: Cheese-topped chicken enchiladas with sour cream sauce.

ingredients.item: canned jalapeño chili peppers, rinsed, seeded, and chopped; or one 4-ounce can diced green chili peppers, drained

instructions.text: Wrap tortillas in foil. Heat in a 350° oven for 10 to 15 minutes or till softened.

For sauce, in a saucepan cook onion, garlic, coriander, and pepper in margarine or butter till onion is tender. Stir flour into sour cream; add to onion mixture. Stir in broth and chili peppers. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat; stir in 1/2 cup of the cheese.

For filling, stir 1/2 cup of the sauce into chicken. Place about 1/4 cup filling atop each tortilla; roll up. Arrange rolls, seam side down, in a lightly greased 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Top with remaining sauce. Bake, covered, in a 350° oven about 35 minutes or till heated through.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake, uncovered, about 5 minutes more or till cheese melts. If desired, sprinkle with olives, tomatoes, and green onions. Let stand 10 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 317)

recipes.title: Create-Your-Own Meat Loaf
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 241
recipes.description: A customizable meat loaf recipe with multiple sauce options.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, milk, onion, herb, salt, pepper, and, if desired, garlic. Add meat; mix well. Shape meat mixture into a loaf.
Add pat meat mixture into a 7½x3½x2-inch or 8x4x2-inch loaf pan. Or, place meat into a shallow baking pan; shape into a 6-inch-diameter circle that is about 2 inches thick.

Bake in a 350° oven for 1 to 1¼ hours or till no pink remains. (Or, place 5 or 4 patties on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 3 inches from the heat about 6 minutes per side.) Spoon off fat. If desired, spoon catsup or barbecue sauce over; bake 5 minutes more. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing. Makes 8 servings.
Ham Loaf: Prepare as above, except substitute dry mustard for the herb and omit salt. Reduce ground beef or lamb to 3/4 pound and add 3/4 pound ground ham. Bake 50 minutes or till juices run clear.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Swedish Meatballs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 241
recipes.description: Classic Swedish meatballs in a creamy sauce, served over noodles.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg, 3/4 cup of the milk, the bread crumbs, onion, and the allspice or nutmeg. Add the ground beef or veal, pork, and parsley; mix well. Shape into 30 meatballs.
Place meatballs in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake in a 375° oven for 15 to 20 minutes or till no pink remains. Drain.

Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan combine remaining milk and bouillon granules. Stir in flour. Cook and stir over medium heat till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minute more. Stir in sour cream; heat through (do not boil).
Pour sauce over meatballs. Serve over noodles. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

notes: Microwave directions: In a mixing bowl combine egg, 1/4 cup of the milk, the bread crumbs, onion, parsley, the 1/4 teaspoon allspice or nutmeg. Add meat; mix well. Shape into 30 meatballs. Place in a 2-quart casserole. Micro-cook, covered, on 100% power (high) for 6 to 8 minutes or till no pink remains, turning meatballs and rearranging once. Drain meatballs on paper towels. Rearrange meatballs in dish. For sauce, in a 1 1/2-quart casserole stir remaining milk, bouillon granules, flour, and 1/4 teaspoon allspice. Micro-cook on high for 3 1/2 to 5 1/2 minutes or till thickened, stirring every minute. Add sour cream; micro-cook 40 to 50 seconds or till heated through, stirring once. Drain meatballs. Pour sauce over meatballs.

recipes.title: Spaghetti and Meatballs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 242
recipes.description: Classic spaghetti with homemade meatballs in tomato sauce.

instructions.text: Combine egg, bread crumbs, 2 tablespoons water, and pepper. Add ground beef and Italian sausage; mix well. Shape into 48 meatballs.

In a skillet heat oil. Add half the meatballs at a time; cook until brown. Drain. Meanwhile, combine onion, green pepper, and mushrooms, cooking until mushrooms are soft, and oregano, basil, and fennel, bay leaf. Stir in tomatoes, tomato paste, water, sugar.
Simmer, uncovered, about 20 minutes or till of desired consistency. Discard bay leaf. Serve over spaghetti. Makes 8 servings.

recipes.title: Porcupine Meatballs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 242
recipes.description: Meatballs with rice that stick out like porcupine quills when cooked, in tomato sauce.

instructions.text: Combine egg, 1/4 cup of the soup, uncooked rice, onion, Worcestershire, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add beef; mix well. Shape meat mixture into 20 meatballs. Place in a large skillet.

Mix the remaining soup and water; pour over meatballs. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 35 to 40 minutes or till rice is tender. Stir sauce; spoon over meatballs to serve. Makes 4 servings.

Microwave directions: Combine egg, 1/4 cup of the soup, rice, onion, Worcestershire, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add beef; mix well. Shape into 20 meatballs. Place in an 8x8x2-inch baking dish, covering with 1/2 cup soup and water; pour over. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 6 minutes. Rearrange meatballs. Add remaining soup mixture. Micro-cook, covered, on high 10 minutes more. Let stand, covered, 5 minutes. Stir sauce; spoon over meatballs. Serve.

recipes.title: Hamburgers
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 243
recipes.description: Classic homemade hamburgers with multiple flavor variations.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, onion, milk, mustard or horseradish, salt, and pepper. Add meat; mix well. Shape meat mixture into four 3/4-inch-thick patties.

Place patties on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 3 inches from the heat for 6 minutes. Turn; broil 6 to 8 minutes more for medium. (Or, place patties in an unheated skillet. Cook, uncovered, over medium heat for 10 to 12 minutes for medium. Turn patties after half the cooking time.)
Serve patties on buns with remaining catsup, mayonnaise or salad dressing, lettuce. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Cheeseburgers: Prepare as above, except add 1/4 cup shredded cheddar, Swiss, or Monterey Jack cheese or 1/4 cup crumbled blue cheese to egg mixture.
Italian-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 tablespoon tomato paste for mustard. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano.
Mexican-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except substitute salsa or taco sauce for the milk. Serve with lettuce, chopped tomatoes, and shredded cheese.
Greek-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except substitute plain yogurt for the milk and 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano, crushed, or 1/4 teaspoon cracked wheat for bread crumbs.
Indian-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except add additional plain yogurt and 1 teaspoon curry powder with the bread crumbs.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: German-Style Burgers
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 243
recipes.description: Hamburgers seasoned German-style with caraway.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg, rye bread crumbs, onion, mustard, and caraway seed. Add meat; mix well. Shape mixture into four 3/4-inch-thick patties.
Place patties on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 3 inches from the heat for 6 minutes. Turn; broil 6 to 8 minutes more. Serve on buns.

recipes.title: Stuffed Burgers
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 244
recipes.description: Hamburger patties stuffed with a savory filling.

ingredients.item: ground beef, veal, or ground lamb
shredded zucchini, carrots, or 1/4 cup shredded cheese

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine bread crumbs, basil, onion salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add meat; mix well. Shape mixture into eight thin patties.

For filling, combine olives and zucchini, carrots, or cheese. Place about 1 tablespoon filling atop each of 4 patties. Spread to within 1/4 inch of edges. Top with remaining patties; seal edges. Place patties on the unheated rack of a broiler pan.
Broil 4 inches from the heat for 6 minutes. Turn patties; broil 6 to 8 minutes more or till no pink remains. Serve on buns. Makes 4 servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Garden Burgers
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 244
recipes.description: Hamburgers with vegetables mixed in and topped with fresh garden toppings.

ingredients.item: parsley or pepper, shredded hash brown potatoes or shredded zucchini

instructions.text: Combine egg, the 3 tablespoons catsup, the basil, onion salt, and pepper. Stir in hash browns or zucchini and bread crumbs. Add meat; mix well. Shape into four 3/4-inch-thick patties.
Place patties on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 3 inches from the heat for 15 to 18 minutes or till no pink remains, turning once. Brush with barbecue sauce or catsup before serving.
Serve patties on buns with additional catsup, mayonnaise, lettuce. Makes 4 servings.

missing_inputs: Not in database: barbecue sauce or catsup
assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for ground pork or ground lamb (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Glazed Ham Patties
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 244
recipes.description: Sweet-glazed ham patties with raisins and apricots.

instructions.text: Combine egg, bread crumbs, raisins, if desired, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add meat and the 1/4 cup onion; mix well. Shape mixture into four 1/2-inch-thick patties.
In a greased 8x8x2-inch baking dish layer 8 bread-slice halves, the cheese slices, then the remaining bread-slice halves. Beat eggs; stir in milk. Stir in orange juice or water. Spoon over patties.
Bake in a 375° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till juices run clear. Stir glaze; spoon over patties. Makes 4 servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Tacos
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 245
recipes.description: Classic ground beef tacos with traditional toppings.

instructions.text: Heat taco shells according to package directions. In a large skillet cook meat and onion till meat is brown. Drain fat.
Stir in undrained tomatoes. Add chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 to 10 minutes or till of desired consistency.
Spoon meat mixture into taco shells. Top with lettuce, cheese, tomato, and, if desired, sour cream and/or guacamole. Makes 12 tacos (6 servings).

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Burritos
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 245
recipes.description: Flour tortillas filled with seasoned beef, beans, and cheese.

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook meat, onion, and garlic till meat is brown. Drain fat. Stir in refried beans, salsa or taco sauce, and chili powder.

Wrap tortillas tightly in foil and heat in a 350° oven about 10 minutes to soften. (Or, wrap tortillas in microwave-safe paper towels. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 30 to 45 seconds or till softened.)
Spoon about 1/2 cup of the meat mixture onto each tortilla just below center. Top with cheese. Fold bottom edge of each tortilla up and over filling. Fold in opposite sides; roll up from the bottom.
Arrange burritos, seam side down, on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till heated through. If desired, serve with sour cream, salsa, and/or guacamole. Serves 6.

notes: Chimichangas: Prepare as above, except wrap tortillas tightly in foil and heat in a 350° oven for about 10 minutes to soften. Fold up the tortilla. In a skillet fry filled tortillas, two or three at a time, in 1 inch of hot oil, starting from the bottom. Secure heat 1 inch of cooking oil for deep-fat frying to 375°. Fry filled tortillas, two or three at a time, about 1 minute on each side or till crisp and golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Keep warm while frying others. Remove wooden picks. Serve chimichangas warm on lettuce and top with tomatoes and cheese. If desired, pass sour cream and guacamole. Do not use microwave directions.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Sloppy Joes
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 245
recipes.description: Classic loose-meat sandwich with a tangy tomato-based sauce.

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook meat, onion, and green pepper till meat is brown. Drain fat. Stir in catsup, water, Worcestershire sauce, and chili powder. Bring to boiling; reduce heat.
Simmer, uncovered, for 5 to 10 minutes or till of desired consistency, stirring occasionally.
Spoon meat mixture onto buns. Makes 6 servings.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 1 1/2-quart casserole combine meat, onion, and green pepper. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 4 to 6 minutes or till no pink remains, stirring once. Drain. Stir in catsup, water, Worcestershire sauce, and chili powder. Micro-cook, covered, on high for 2 to 3 minutes or till bubbly. Serve on buns.

recipes.title: Lasagna
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 246
recipes.description: Classic layered pasta with meat sauce and cheese, for a cheesy, vegetarian version see page 159.

ingredients.item: ground beef, pork, or bulk Italian sausage
ricotta cheese or cream-style cottage cheese

instructions.text: For meat sauce, in a large saucepan cook meat, onion, and garlic till meat is brown and onion is tender. Drain fat. Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato sauce, oregano, basil, fennel, if desired, salt, and pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 15 to 20 minutes or till slightly thickened, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. Drain noodles; rinse with cold water. Drain again.
For filling, combine eggs, ricotta or cottage cheese, Parmesan or Romano cheese, and parsley.
Layer half of the cooked noodles in a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Spread with half of the filling. Top with half of the meat sauce and half of the mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers.
Bake in a 375° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till heated through. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Makes 8 servings.
To make ahead: Prepare as above, except after assembling, cover and refrigerate up to 24 hours. Uncover and bake in a 375° oven about 35 minutes more or till heated through.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Pizza
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 247
recipes.description: Homemade pizza with yeast crust and your choice of toppings.

instructions.text: In a large bowl combine 1 1/4 cups of the flour, the yeast, and salt. Add warm water and oil.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping the bowl constantly. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes. Using a wooden spoon, stir in as much of the remaining flour as you can.

Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead in enough of the remaining flour to make a moderately stiff dough that is smooth and elastic (6 to 8 minutes total). Divide dough in half. Cover; let rest 10 minutes.

Grease two 12-inch pizza pans or baking sheets. On a lightly floured surface, roll each half of dough into a 13-inch circle. Transfer to pans. Build up edges slightly. Do not let rise. Bake in a 425° oven about 12 minutes or till lightly browned.
Spread Pizza Sauce over hot crusts. Top with desired meat, vegetables, and cheese. Bake in a 425° oven for 10 to 15 minutes more or till bubbly. Makes 2 pizzas (8 servings).

notes: Thin Pizzas: Make pizza dough as above. Grease two baking sheets. On a lightly floured surface, roll each half of dough into a 13-inch circle. Transfer to pans or baking sheets. If desired, sprinkle each crust with cornmeal. On a lightly floured surface, roll each half of dough edges slightly. Do not let rise. Bake in a 425° oven about 10 minutes or till lightly browned. Spread Pizza Sauce over hot crusts. Top as desired. Bake about 8 minutes more or till bubbly. Makes 2 thin pizzas.

Pan Pizzas: Grease two 11x7x1 1/2-inch or 9x9x2-inch baking pans or two 12-inch pizza pans. If desired, sprinkle with cornmeal. With greased hands, pat dough into bottoms and halfway up sides of prepared pans. Cover; let rise halfway (30 to 45 minutes). Bake in a 375° oven 20 to 25 minutes or till lightly browned. Meanwhile, prepare Pizza Sauce. Spread Pizza Sauce over hot crusts. Top as desired. Bake 15 to 20 minutes more or till bubbly. Serves 8.

Pizza Sauce: In a medium saucepan combine one undrained 7 1/2-ounce can tomatoes, cut up, 1/4 cup chopped onion, 1 tablespoon dried crushed oregano, 1 teaspoon crushed dried basil, 1/4 teaspoon crushed fennel seed (optional), 1/4 teaspoon crushed hot red pepper (optional), and 1 clove garlic, minced. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, about 30 minutes or till thick enough to spread on pizza. Makes about 1 cup.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Calzones
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 247
recipes.description: Folded pizza pockets stuffed with meat, vegetables, and cheese.

instructions.text: Prepare pizza dough. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Add meat, mushrooms, green pepper, and olives to sauce.
Divide dough into 4 portions. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion into a 7-inch circle.

Spread about 1/4 cup of the meat mixture onto half of each circle to within 1/2 inch of the edge. Sprinkle mozzarella and Parmesan over meat mixture. Fold dough in half over filling. Fold edges to seal; cut slits in top of dough to allow steam to escape.
Bake in a 375° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till golden. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Crab Cakes
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 179

ingredients.item: crabmeat, cooked, or two 6-ounce cans crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed

instructions.text: In a medium bowl combine egg, mayonnaise, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Stir in crab. Add half of the crumbs (about 3 minutes). Add half of margarine and heat about 3 minutes. Add half of the crab mixture to skillet. Press into four 3-inch patties.
Fry for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or till golden. Remove; keep warm. Repeat with remaining margarine, oil, and crab mixture. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 179)

recipes.title: Crab Mornay
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 179
recipes.description: Topped with a classic cheese sauce.

ingredients.item: sliced fresh mushrooms, onion, and celery
crabmeat, cooked, or two 6-ounce cans crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook mushrooms, onion, and celery in margarine till tender. Add red pepper. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in crabmeat and wine. Cook and stir 1 minute more.

Stir in crabmeat, chopped egg, pimiento, to and mustard. Spoon into four 10-ounce casseroles or coquille shells. Top with bread crumbs with the 1 tablespoon margarine; sprinkle over casseroles. Top with almonds. Bake in a 375° oven about 20 minutes or till tops brown. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 179)

recipes.title: Deviled Crab
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 179

ingredients.item: crabmeat, cooked, or two 6 1/2-ounce cans crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed

instructions.text: In a saucepan melt the 2 tablespoons margarine. Stir in flour. Add milk and hot pepper sauce all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in crabmeat, chopped egg, pimiento, cheese, and mustard. Spoon into four 10-ounce casseroles or coquille shells. Toss bread crumbs with the 1 tablespoon margarine; sprinkle over casseroles. Top with almonds. Bake in 375° oven about 20 minutes or till tops brown. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 179)

recipes.title: Shrimp Creole
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 180
recipes.description: This spicy New Orleans classic is the perfect match for rice.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen peeled and deveined shrimp

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. In a large skillet cook onion, celery, green pepper, and garlic in margarine or butter till tender. Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato paste, bay leaf, sugar, paprika, red pepper, and salt. Bring to boiling.
Stir together water and cornstarch. Stir into tomato mixture. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Add shrimp to the tomato mixture. Stir cook, covered, for 1 to 3 minutes or till shrimp turn pink. Remove bay leaf. Serve over rice. Serves 4.

notes: Fish Creole: Prepare as above, except substitute 12 ounces fresh or frozen fish fillets for shrimp. Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fillets into 1-inch pieces. Add fish to the tomato mixture. Cook and stir till the fish is thickened and bubbly. Cook and after 3 to 5 minutes, covered, on high for 1 to 2 minutes or till shrimp turn pink. Remove bay leaf. Serve over rice.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 180)

recipes.title: Shrimp Chow Mein
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 180

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen peeled and deveined shrimp
hot cooked rice or chow mein noodles

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. Cut any large shrimp in half lengthwise. For sauce, combine water, soy sauce, cornstarch, bouillon granules, and ginger. Set aside.

Preheat a wok or large skillet over high heat; add cooking oil. (Add more oil as necessary during cooking.) Stir-fry mushrooms, onion, and garlic for 1 minute. Remove. Stir-fry shrimp for 2 to 3 minutes or till shrimp turn pink. Push to side of wok or skillet.

Stir sauce; add to center of wok. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add water chestnuts, bean sprouts, pea pods, and cooked vegetables. Heat ingredients together to coat with sauce. Heat through. Serve over hot cooked rice. Serves 4.

notes: Scallop Chow Mein: Prepare as above, except substitute 12 ounces fresh or frozen scallops for the shrimp. Thaw scallops, if frozen. Cut any large scallops into bite-size pieces. Stir-fry scallops for 2 to 3 minutes or till they turn opaque.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 180)

recipes.title: Shrimp in Garlic Butter
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 181

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen peeled and deveined shrimp

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. In a large skillet heat margarine or butter over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 4 minutes or till shrimp turn pink. Sprinkle with parsley.
Above except for substitute 12 ounces fresh or frozen sea scallops for the shrimp. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Scallops in Garlic Butter: Prepare as above, except substitute 12 ounces fresh or frozen scallops for the shrimp. Cut any large scallops in half. If frozen, thaw scallops. Stir-fry scallops for 3 to 5 minutes or till they turn opaque.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 181)

recipes.title: French-Fried Shrimp
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 181
recipes.description: Putting the shrimp dry before dipping them into the batter gives a crisper coating.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen shrimp in shells
shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. Peel shrimp, leaving the last few sections before the tails and the tails intact. To devein shrimp, use a sharp knife to make a shallow slit along the back of each shrimp. Remove the sandy black vein, if present.

To butterfly shrimp, make a deeper slit along the back of shrimp, cutting almost all the way through the shrimp on a flat surface so that the sides open to resemble a butterfly. Rinse; pat dry with paper towels. Set aside.
For batter, combine flour, cornmeal, sugar, and salt. Combine egg, water, and the 2 tablespoons oil. Add to flour mixture. Beat with a rotary beater till smooth.

In a large deep saucepan or deep-fat fryer, heat 2 inches shortening or oil to 375°. Meanwhile, pat shrimp dry. Dip shrimp into batter. Fry shrimp, 5 or 6 at a time, in hot fat for 2 to 3 minutes or till golden. Remove from fat. Drain on paper towels. Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying remainder. Serve with Cocktail Sauce, if desired. Makes 6 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 181)

recipes.title: Linguine with White Clam Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 182
recipes.description: The nutty rich taste of this alternative recipe is well worth the effort required.

instructions.text: Cook linguine according to package directions. Meanwhile, drain clams, reserving liquid from clams. Add enough of the cream or milk to make 1 cup liquid. Set aside.
In a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, oregano, salt, and pepper. Add the 1 cup liquid. Cook and stir for 1 minute more.
Stir in clams, parsley and wine. Heat through. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Linguine with Red Clam Sauce: Prepare as above, except stir one 15-ounce can tomato sauce and 1/4 cup dry red wine into cooked onion and garlic. Heat through. Serve sauce over linguine. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 182)

recipes.title: Coquilles Saint-Jacques
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 182

instructions.text: Thaw scallops, if frozen. Halve any large scallops. In a large skillet, cook mushrooms and onion in the 1/4 cup margarine till tender. Stir in flour and pepper. Add cream. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
In egg yolk; stir about half of the hot mixture into yolk. Return all to skillet. Add scallops. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes or till scallops turn opaque.

Spoon scallop mixture into 4 coquille shells or au gratin dishes or four 10-ounce custard cups. Place together bread crumbs, melted margarine, and parsley; sprinkle over scallops or mixture. Bake in a 400° oven for 7 to 9 minutes or till crumbs are brown. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 182)

recipes.title: Crawfish Étouffée
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 183

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen peeled crawfish tails or deveined shrimp

instructions.text: Thaw crawfish tails or shrimp, if frozen. In a large skillet cook onion, celery, green pepper, and garlic in crawfish fat, margarine, or butter for 10 minutes or till tender. Add tomato sauce, red pepper, 1 cup water, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Cook and stir till bubbly.
Add crawfish tails or shrimp. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 4 to 5 minutes or till crawfish are tender (shrimp turn pink). Season to taste. Serve with rice. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Oysters au Gratin
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 183

instructions.text: Pat oysters dry. In a large skillet cook 4 oysters in 1 tablespoon of the margarine for 3 to 4 minutes or till edges curl. Transfer oysters to four 10-ounce casseroles. Drain.

For sauce, in the same skillet cook mushrooms and garlic in the 2 tablespoons margarine till tender. Stir in flour. Add milk and wine all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in parsley, Worcestershire sauce. Spoon over oysters.
Mix crumbs, Parmesan, and melted margarine. Sprinkle over sauce. Bake in 400° oven for 10 minutes or till crumbs are brown. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 183)
